To be fair, I asked Angel @ 459 if we could split the $400.00 deposit 50/50 and we both would be out $200.00 each instead of my family and I having to eat the entire $400.00. name: Darryl Gutierrez
text: This is a museum in the private home of artist and poet (Maria) Howard Weeden. The cost is $5 and the tour is about an hour long. I found it to be a fascinating glimpse into not only Weeden's life and art, but also the early history of Huntsville and North Alabama. Like many private museums, Weeden house has had to branch out to make ends meet so they rent the place out as an event venue as well. This means that Lynn, their lone employee is stretched rather thin as tour guide, event coordinator, curator and hostess so you should make an appointment for the guided tour. Nevertheless, she was as gracious and informative a hostess as you could wish for. Word of caution- there are stairs so if you have mobility issues you may miss the upstairs part of the tour.

name: Ken Barnes
text:
Our wedding and reception was in the back yard of the Weeden House. We had lots of questions and requests, and their event/property manager was incredibly flexible and responsive. It was a magical event, and the Weeden House was a huge part of making it feel special.

Note: it's one of the few facilities in Huntsville that does weddings but allows you to bring your own alcoholic drinks. No forced catering!

name: James Chamberlain
text: Has an expanded exhibit for the Alabama Bicentennial. From February 1-March 7 2019. The home, furnishings, paintings, etc. give a good sense of life before and after the Civil War. Great way to learn more about local Huntsville area history. Guides knowledgeable and helpful.

name: Kewanee Fox
text: Fred Jones is the owner of this facility. When you call him, he answers the phone or he doesn’t take forever to return your call.  He is very personable and easy to work with. When I tell you this man invests in his property, he does. I have rented it over the years. It has improved from just a kitchen to having everything you need. It has a warmer, chafing racks a rolling cart, a cooler....the list goes on. It is well kept. The restrooms are clean. Mr. Jones is very accommodating and his prices are reasonable. He doesn't allow alcohol and I'm sure that has contributed to the longevity of his facility. The only thing that could improve it is the parking. However, I'm sure in the future he may can work something out with the animal clinic next door or can clear some land to black top for more parking.  Even if that doesn't improve, using his spot is an investment in him and the community.

name: Lexii Jackson
text: This review is overdue. I brought my girlfriend here to partake in splatter painting as one of our anniversary activities. The reservation process was quick and effortless on their website. You walk in and have your temp taken, you're given a squirt of sanitizer for your hands and then you sign your waiver if you did not already complete this step online. After completing the waiver a super friendly employee directed us to a table that had been set up with a cute anniversary sign, decorations, chocolate, champagne and our blank canvas. We were then able to add designs with tape that would be peeled off post splatter painting while enjoying our glass of champagne. Once we finished our champagne, part 2 of the fun began. We were taken to the splatter paint room where we put on our protective wear over our clothes, shoe protectors and goggles. While an employee went over the basics, we were given a bluetooth speaker to play music,  they exited, turned off the lights, we blasted our music and the anniversary paint party began! You reserve the room for an hour so you can splatter till you can't splatter anymore. Once finished, one of the owners came in to grab our masterpiece to place on the table to have the tape peeled off and allow it to dry a little. We took off all protective gear, wiped what little paint got on our faces off and decided to sit at their cute bar station to have a couple margaritas and a beer. They have a decent selection of snacks and drinks. The strawberry margaritas were sooooo good. You can easily kill some time while your paint is trying to dry. My girlfriend and I got the pleasure of meeting and speaking to the owners who happen to be husband and wife. They were nothing short of a delight! Wonderful personalities, warm and welcoming. They informed us about their various craft classes that another group was doing. This particular group was making candles and they let us know what a great and fun experience they had. My girlfriend and I will certainly be back to try one of the crafts out. If you're looking for something fun and different,  come here. The owners deserve all of Bham's business! Can't wait to return. Thank you all for such an amazing experience!

name: Jesse Dabbs
text: Very fun, and the owners are really nice. Very good people. Definitely going back for more fun.

text: Got to spend my birthday here and it was a PERFECT! We had a fabulous girls night trying out all different crafts. A few of us went into the splatter paint room with glow paint which I highly recommend-- we were able to play our own music too which made it such a fun experience! The staff was super friendly and accommodating and I highly recommend the experience. By the way-- did I mention that they have a beer and wine bar plus snacks?!  Alcohol always makes crafts more fun :))

They were so helpful and patient as we worked on our projects. They also had a wide variety of drinks available. The owners were incredibly friendly and accommodating! text: Great place to allow your creative juices to flow.  The owners are amazing.

name: Natalie
text: Had such an amazing time here! Evan and Melonie were so amazing to my group and we will definitely be back!!!

name: Kinsey Copeland
text: My friend and I went to Pinspiration to do the Splatter room and we had a blast! We got the s’mores and mimosa bucket.. it was delish! The owners of the place were so nice and helpful! Will definitely be doing this again :)

name: Janie Flores
text: Drinks & DIY, need I say more?

name: Ashley Parker
text: Phenomenal Service!

name: Jenny Stephens
text: Really fun birthday party.

name: Heidi Elnora
text: Love this space. It’s clean and quaint. Great staff. Perfect for any small gathering.

name: Jerri Simmons
text: Great place for  baby showers/teas or bridal showers/teas, or birthday parties.  Fantastic. Good parking  and convenient.

name: Elizabeth Singleton
text: This is the perfect small space for engagement parties, bridal showers, etc. The best part is you can decorate how you’d like! Staff is also great to work with

name: Maygan Hamilton
text: What a fun venue space!!!!!Great atmosphere with such a unique location! Perfect for bridal showers, engagement parties, and baby showers!!!!!! LOve LOve LOve it!!!!!!

name: robert ungerbuehler
text: Never been there, I'm sure it's nice

name: Chad Johnson
text: Once in a lifetime experience.  I was very surprised at the knowledge I learned from the training from light horse tactical. Team building experience was fantastic. This training is not for the weak but very rewarding and well worth the work you put in.

name: Jonathan Bina
text: Best camp ever for a kid thinking of going into the military.

name: rebecca bishop
text: ***EMPTY PROMISES!***** PROTECT YOUR BELONGINGS!*****Was Promised the building would be complete before the event. The only thing added during the 5 month planning stage was the actual bathroom stall (at least we can relieve ourselves in private), a laundry room door, and partial HVAC system. Then they promised the floor would be cleaned at least...it was not! There were approx. 80 wet mattresses next to the building that were promised to be moved by the "workers". The wedding party had to move the wet mattresses to keep from looking like a city dump while the self proclaimed "COL" Joe(enlisted navy of 4 yrs does NOT make you a Colonel) stood with his hands on his hips and ordering where to put them. When the 3 workers were asked by the groom's mom and bride to help with the mattresses they replied "We are busy hanging these wasp catchers" then proceeded to flip the middle finger at one another for about 5 minutes...(how many camp liberty workers does it take to hang one wasp catcher) I have to say, the ONE star ONLY represents the GREAT ability the owner has at ordering commands to the wedding party and their helpers. Joe, the owner, brought strangers (to solicit) into the bridal suite and lodging with our personal belongings (purses, wallets, clothing, luggage, ect) unannounced while we were attending the reception. This was discovered when the bride and groom's moms went to change after the wedding. Later we found that he had released the brides beloved dog into the outdoors and didn't notify anyone. The owner later hovered at the reception then uninvited, went to help himself to the catering service(that WE provided) before all the guests had a chance to eat! If it had not been for the event coordinator "Amanda" Nothing would have gotten done. She tried her hardest with what she was allowed to do. She had absolutely NO help from ANYONE at the facility. Thank you Amanda. You should open your own venue and you could be really successful. Why waste your skills on an unappreciative, undeserving jerk! Joe Land has little man syndrome. What a JOKE! True Leaders understand the meaning of LEAD AND SERVE. Joe Land serves NO ONE! He orders!(lots of big macs and milkshakes by the looks of it) Definitely a complete "do it yourself" establishment.

name: Geraldine Cuesta-Aviles
text: I have had the experience of being on the Camp Liberty property on numerous occasions. The premises are clean and neatly kept. The staff is cordial and friendly and are always accommodating. They really fixed up the Chapel and the Bridal suite simply looks exquisite for bridal parties. Heritage Hall Banquet facility has enough room for a large Wedding party and its guests with an elevated area for a DJ. Independence Hall is a well maintained sleeping facility with beds and bathrooms for guests with a comfortable common area that has a full kitchen and living room where your guests can mingle. With the beautiful setting and facilities it is a perfect location for many different events.

name: Fubar
text: The guy that owns this place is a sham. 4 years in the military and wants to play colonel to a bunch of children. His son has NEVER served but has the audacity to wear a US Army uniform? That is illegal and considered stolen valor, impersonating a US serviceman. This place disgusts me. I did serve my time, and find it absolutely disgusting and deplorable that someone who didn't earn the right to wear that uniform wears it to play soldier.

resp.text: COL Land, XMC has been working with youth for the last 30+ years and makes it no secret his career. With that said both the State of Alabama and the Commonwealth of Kentucky have awarded him as an Honorary Colonel, and he has recovered numerous other accolades including international recognition. His son has never claimed to have served in anything other than youth programs as a Cadet and then 12+ years as an adult Cadre. All XMC personnel wear distinctive XMC Cadre branch tapes and patches to conform with Army Regulation 670-1, the claim of stolen valor is unwarranted and a slander. We would be very interested in how you would like to attempt to slander the rest of the staff who include retired CSMs, MAJ, LTCs, USMC DIs, etc... No program in the world can compare to XMC. We currently have our program graduates attending West Point, the U.S. Air Force Academy and on ROTC scholarships across the nation. While there is no way to know who posted the review be assured it is motivated by people who do not have the best interests of the youth of the USA in mind. If anyone reading this review would like to discuss the above accusations please give us a call.

name: Lynda Clanton
text: Excellent camp. If you have military minded youngsters age 13 to 18. They get a taste of what it's like to be a soldier. Very Highly recommended. Thank you COL Land and staff, and mascot Major Hero.

name: Bill Owen
text: An amazing facility that just keeps getting better every time I visit.  Top notch staff that is capable of hosting so many different events flawlessly.   Can not give a higher recommendation!

name: Lorie Dove
text: I absolutely love this place! The owner and staff are the most generous and helpful people! They have great rates for events and the land and scenery is beautiful! If your looking for a place for family events, Corprate retreats, weddings, or just a get away place this where its at!

name: Sandra Guerrero
text:
This locations was booked this past weekend for my sister’s wedding.  We thought the location was beautiful and would be worth the price paid.  We appreciated that he was prior military and this place prides it’s self on service to our country.  Our family is heavily populated with current and former military. We thought this location would be amazing but it WAS NOT. The owner was not consistent and frequently changed the rules, saying he was more than accommodating.  He advised that he had previously had a brides mother escorted out, by police, for “nit-picking”, which is what he did the entire wedding. I guess this was to act as a warning to us. The bridal area was very pretty but smelled of sewage that seeped from the bathrooms.

When we arrived to decorate the day before the wedding we realized the reception area was filthy.  We had to go buy cleaning products. The groom had to clean the beams and walls of spider webs and bugs. The bathroom was full of fruit flies, knats, spiders, and other bugs.  The windows were all so dirty you couldn’t see out of them. The location was definitely left in a better condition than we found it. In a written document he wrote “he takes out the garbage”.  We bagged all of the garbage and left it in one location (that he saw when he did the inspection and refunded the entire deposit since we cleaned and followed all the rules); however, the following day the owner sent a picture via text showing that the garbage had been ransacked by animals since HE left it outside all night.  He has a dog that roams. This is very unprofessional as some are afraid or allergic to dogs.

Like most weddings, the ceremony started a little late. We rented the location for the entire day so timing was not an issue. 10 minutes after the set start time, the owner went to the groom stated the ceremony was to start at four and is late and then began to tap his watch.  At one point, he pulled up a chair and sat directly in the middle of the room and stared at the bridal party as we were getting ready to start the ceremony.

Many of our guest complained to us about feeling extremely uncomfortable with him and his constant hovering.  We would not recommend this location for a wedding.

name: Best Budz
text: The haunt at camp liberty is the only reason I come out.  Its a beautiful place,  but a bit behind on repairs.

name: Rich Holladay
text: This facility has it all and extensive improvement and modernization is ongoing.  The grounds are absolutely beautiful and well kept for any event you might wish to hold.  I wholeheartedly recommend this venue to anyone, whether it be for a wedding or any other social gathering.

name: Krista Ridling
text: The BEST facility and staff ever!!! Very clean, professional, organized-- they go above and beyond to accommodate everyone. And what a gorgeous property!! We can't wait to go back!

name: Allen Thomas
text: The facility is a true gem. It is obvious that the staff exhibit pride because it shows in the amount of effort that is given to the satisfaction of every individual that they serve. Great facility, professional curteous staff. Highly recommended for virtually any venue.

name: Cory Surla
text: Camp Liberty Staff made me feel like I was at home, like I had extended family in Battle AL...  They put the wow baxk into customers service and the going above and beyond what is expected in may stay with family enough I might move my planned wedding from TX to Camp Liberty AL for my whole family Retreat.....  Thanks for the WOW in life again.... GOD bless your staff and all there at Camp Liberty AL.

name: Oliver Wright
text: Camp Liberty is a beautiful place for any type of event.  The landscape is well maintained by friendly staff and quite the sight to see.  Great venue!

name: Brian
text: What a great place, this was my second time there. I can't believe I didn't write a review before this.  Facilities are awesome, the staff is helpful and goes out of their way to help you.  My buddies and I have decided this is our go to place for get togethers from now on. Thank you Camp Liberty we will be back.

name: Jennifer Klinglesmith
text: The owner and staff were a joy to work with for my event! I wish all facilities made it so seemless. I'll definitely host more events!!!

name: Garret Howell
text: It was the best thing that ever happened to me. I became a cadet over the summer.

name: Repo 85
text: I was introduced to the team at XMC through my local VFW.  The cadre there have so much heart in what they are trying to accomplish!  After seeing the multiple cadets coming back on their spring breaks (from different states) to help aid in something they truly love, I knew this place was different!  You can trust the staff with your children. I guarantee they (and you) will love the facilities and what the camp is all about!

name: Tracy Oneill
text: I have worked with the Lands on several occasions and have been nothing but totally satisfied.   They are extremely professional and courteous with the job that they provide.  I would recommend them highly to anyone.

name: Julia Reniger
text:
5 Stars is not enough - 10 stars?!?!?!
I could not be happier with the facilities and the staff at Camp Liberty! My sons experience at the camp is unmatched and he continues to speak of it and express his happiness and the lessons learned! He was provided with great accommodations!!! The staff were always there to facilitate and educate! The entire experience was a once in a lifetime (which he finds himself fortunate to expirince twice).
The staff also took great pride in the programs they provide for the kids and are amazing at communicating with the parents. I was super concerned about my son going out of state, at such distance from home, to go to the camp. However, after the experience our family had with the program, I would HIGHLY recommend it (and it's amazing staff) to every single person considering a military type camp experience!!!! If you join this 'family' you absolutely won't regret it!!!!!!

name: Savannah Mcneal
text: One the best facilities ever, very helpful staff. Willing to work and help you! Amazing place!

name: Robert Clark
text: As the 4th Brigade Commander of the Alabama Service Corps, I wish to complement the Camp Liberty facilities and staff on having an excellent public relation vision. The Alabama Service Corps and Camp Liberty relationship started back in the spring of 2016, when Camp Liberty was just starting out. The staff have always been eager to present the capabilities of the facilities of Camp Liberty as a prime choice for our use. During training and exercises if a suggestion comes up about making some last-minute changes to a venue, the staff have always been agreeable and made it happen. Over the past 18 months I have seen the facilities improve many times over, i.e. the Chapel, the repelling tower, the obstacle course, the zip line, the range, etc, and they are only get better. As for the staff, I can’t say enough of how enjoyable they are to work with. The one thing that stands out is the consistent mind set of all the staff members, by that, if one person says something, then that is the way it will happen. It almost seems that everyone knows how the other person will answer a question. While paperwork is done from habit, a hand shake and a spoken promise is always done. The facilities are great, the staff is excellent, and it’s always a pleasure to deal with Camp Liberty. I look forward too many more years working with the staff and using the facilities at Camp Liberty.

name: David Thibodeaux
text:
I have flown in twice on cross country travels and landed at Cullman Regional Airport. The staff picked me up.  I stayed several nights.  I've also traveled with my family.  We stopped in 2 different times & spent 1 night each time.
I cannot say enough good things about the hospitality and cleanliness we enjoyed at Camp Liberty. It was well organized and meticulously maintained.
My wife is very picky and she loved staying there because we were made to feel like family vs. a hotel where other guests might be partying late at night.
-David Thibodeaux

name: John Wideman
text:
I'm not one to take time to write a review but when it comes to Camp Liberty I can't say enough good things.  From the moment you enter the gate it is obvious the amount of work that has gone into maintaining the grounds and buildings.  Anyone who has served in any of the armed services will find a familiarity like stepping onto a regular military post.  On Camp Liberty the staff are professional and dedicated to their mission to provide the best experience possible.  They do this from their hearts and take pride in everything they do, not because they are being paid but because they see the Camp as a reflection of themselves and strive to maintain the highest standards.  What one reviewer refers to as "militant"  in a negative context, I would rather refer to as military precision.
Anyone who would like to experience Camp Liberty as a venue for a reunion, wedding or any gathering can rest assured they will have a fantastic time and the staff will do everything within reason to guarantee this.

name: ANGEL ROMEU
text: Awesome facilities and relax environment. Management is courteous and efficient. Will definitely recommend.

name: Nancy Steele
text: It has the cutest chapel and reunion lodge, as well as a huge party barn!

name: Mandy Holsombake
text: If the stars could go any lower I would make this a negative. We came up for my cousins wedding and I have never in my life seen a brides special day ruined the way the folks up there ruined it. Rude rude rude! The wedding party had to clean the place before the reception could begin and was forced to walk around and clean up the cigarette butts that littered the entire place. Some gentlemen who I later found out was the owner was showing the place in the middle of the wedding!! He even took people up to the bridal suite where the bridal party had left their things during the wedding. I'm 100% sure these positive reviews are just his friends blocking out the negative but heed my warnings, do not use this place for any special event.

name: Tommy (TommyFDNY)
text:
Being a highly decorated member of the military community, a very accomplished member of the New York City Fire Department, I found it highly important that I pass along some insight about this unique organization.

Today's society and organizational virtues are one of a diminishing importance. Yet, "Camp Liberty" and the home of the youth program(s)  "Extreme Military Challenge", (XMC) is a program of excellence.

It's the fact that every team member they have on board, is of the top tier military family members,  veterans, and associates.

It's the proof in the many successful leaders that are being graduated from XMC to serve our country. It's the unbelievable dedication of this organization to constantly invest; not selfishly divest profits , to improve the infrastructure to better the  programs for the kids!  It's the professionalism, the high standard of honor, and insurmountable  promise to the kids, for the kids, and with the kids, of this shining star that you all need to be excited about.

Col. Land, has seamlessly executed a dream. This dream has blossomed into a well run, professional, safe, challenging, and wholesome leadership molding environment.

I need to stress the fact that I was in NO WAY paid, instructed, nor offered anything to give my opinion. Those who know me, know Im extremely honest, and critical to excellence and honor. This organization is an absolute for our kids. It holds the same values that I hold dearly, and what all of us military members were enshrined in; honor, discipline, and leadership!

name: Sabrina Garrison
text:
We rented this venue for my wedding this past weekend. I fell in love with the chapel the first time I saw it and felt like this would be the perfect place to have our special day. We booked the venue around Feb for an Aug wedding. Prior to the wedding my now husband was concerned about the property being grown up due to the lack of lawn care a month before our day, when my mother, whom is the one that rented the place and handled all that with Mr. Joe, tried to get in touch with him on several occasions she couldn’t reach him when she finally did and she expressed her concerns about the state of the property he was very condescending and seemed to be scolding her when she brought up her concerns. We overlooked that and wanted to proceed with the event so nothing was said. He made some of my wedding party and guest feel very uncomfortable. Our ceremony started late which was fine but I was told after by my husband that he came up to him taping his watch questioning why we were running late and then pulls up a chair in the basement where the bridal party was sitting and watched us as we were getting ready to line up and start the ceremony. Our arrangement was we would contact him via hand radio so he can come and let some of my family load chairs into his truck so we could transport them to the reception hall so my guest would have seats at dinner. When the lady who came to do my makeup was packing up during the ceremony Mr. Joe went in there and told her about having to have the mother of the bride at a wedding he had there escorted out and informed her that with his experience if there is alcohol there is a problem. We did not have any issues i must say. I hired an officer as well as i had a guest that is high up on the local police force. He hooverd so much I’m assuming in anticipation that something would happen that he made us feel uncomfortable.
We were told he provided all tables and chairs but then the Monday before when my husband and I did our walk through he informed us about us having to have some people to help move the chairs from the chapel to the reception hall because he did not have enough or we could rent some. While we were doing the walk through my husband realized how dirty the windows and chapel/reception hall was. He is extremely OCD and was very agitated by that. I, however, thought perhaps he would have it cleaned up by Saturday. I was wrong. We ended up having to clean the window and sweep down cobwebs and bugs throughout the hall. My father wanted to buy curtains for the windows because it was so bad. We didn’t complain to him about the state of the venue we just did what needed to be done. When we did the after walk through my mother told him there had been a horrible sewage smell in the bathroom where the bridal party was getting ready and he responded nothing I can do know. She was just letting him know for future reference but he was a smart alec my mother let it go. During the walk through of the reception he mentioned the garbage we had it piled up together. My father told him that on the hand written receipt for the deposit Mr. Joe gave him stated the “owner/president would take garbage out.” Mr Joe then said oh I was being a smart a**.  At that point I walked away because I did not want to cause a scene. We left the garbag in bags piled up by the door Mr Joe gave the full deposit back to my father. The buildings we used were left in 100 times better condition the when we arrived. Sunday morning he sent a picture of the trash where I’m assuming due to him leaving it out all night an animal or his dog that he lets run freely got into some of it. But all he sent was the picture nothing else no text and even when my dad responsed to him 3 times he never responded back. We really loved the fact of how patriotic the owner and workers are. We appreciated what they do there. I come from a family with a lot of military and most were there that day. Overall my day was still extremely special and amazing but I feel he has bad business practice and wasn’t very prepared for our event.

name: Jennifer Harrington
text: It was wonderful for our SCA event! Just absolutely perfect.

name: Gary Tillman
text: Camp Liberty is a state of the art facility with a wonderful and friendly staff, beautiful views and an ambiance all on its own.

name: Celine B
text: Amazing program for (not delinquent) teens who either want a challenge or to be in a military environment

name: Danielle O'Donnell
text: Can't wait for my daughter's wedding!

name: Ray Lee
text: I cant say enough good things about Camp Liberty, its a smashing place and highly recommended for all. I shall be coming from the UK again this year to spend time on camp, I cant wait

name: Robert Griffin
text: Great place for all kinds of events

name: tiffany stuart
text: What a fantastic organization!  I must say that the team at XMC  does absolutely everything to make sure that they just continue to improve their program and everything on thier grounds.   From last year to this, they have kept all of the returning families upto date with  ongoing  progress.  It is wonderful  to watch how HARDCORE they are about being the best!    Thanks XMC!

name: Shannon Johnson
text: Grass around the fence, parking area and around the swimming pool needed to be cut. They had cut a few small areas around the pool. Picnic tables falling apart. So if renting for a pool party, I would say save your money do something else.

name: Richard Jones
text:
The surroundings are beautiful and the staff were very helpful and kind.
Thank you for the time we spent at Camp Liberty.

name: Pam Mann
text: My daughter had her wedding here April 29 2017. What started out as a great deal quickly turned into a nightmare. In 4 short months joe land turned our planning into a militant experience.  From directing wedding party members and family members to perform laborious tasks to bringing visitors into our private event and taking pictures, eating the reception food uninvited to telling me to pick up cigarette butts that his hired wedding planner smoked and finally telling family members that checks bounced due to his lack of ability to follow instruction the entire experience was exhausting and a scam. There were no trash cans at the reception despite several requests, there were no linens until 10 am the day of the wedding , and there was a loaded AR 15 in the chapel... nightmare.   There were potential clients In the privately rented bridal suite where we were changing clothes. Without permission....DO not use this venue!!!!its a joke.

resp.text:
The crux of this review is "What started out as a great deal" . We gave a great rate to the customer with the caveats that certain tasks had to be done and our venue was taken care of. For $2500 (not including bounced check fees) the party was provided our chapel, a location for the wedding party to stay for a night and a reception hall. We provided chairs and tables, and a number of other amenities that would not normally be included in a rental cost without an extra charge. This was to allow us to get good pictures to further promote our facility. In the end it resulted in the person who posted this review being told to leave the property with a police escort. To address the most glaring portion of her review is the AR15 statement, this was a lasertag gun that is a service we offer to groups on the camp, not a loaded firearm.

A couple of bad reviews are not great, but are better than the threats of bodily harm from members of the wedding party, those same people who left the building they used in a shambles. We provided a great price to a group because we are dedicated to providing a good service to veterans and their families. As a result we dealt with weeks of demands that only ever increased in scope and did our best to meet the mark as we had an agreement with this family that we would be taking pictures and using the event to help our marketing. This family got the deal of a lifetime and only wanted more and more and we foolishly provided. The linens we rented at an obscene price since it was last minute to make sure the event happened with some class were not part of the original agreement. But due to this group we have updated our policies and contracts so that we are never again forced to clean-up our lodging facility of the tossed around sugar and creamer and various other garbage these people dumped everywhere. The result of this group's use of our venue was a police report of the state of the property after they left.

name: Toni Anderson
text: Great place, staff was very helpful. Would definitely recommend them.

name: Eli Held
text: does not know how to do a wedding extremely rude and difficult people to work with

name: Troy Joslyn
text: Beautiful camp

name: Eagle Man
text: Not handicapped accessible to people

name: Gary Harper
text: Great retreat

name: Kristin Smith
text: This place was sooooo awesome! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I highly recommend doing this while visiting Orange Beach Alabama!!

name: Jayden Marsh
text: Definitely recommend to anyone traveling or in the area. My girlfriend and I loved it and got a ton of fun, goofy, cute pictures! Thanks to Tracy we got to look around before and check out all 50 backgrounds and even got help with different poses and pictures! The Cool Shots Selfie Museum was definitely a fun part of our trip.

name: Brianna Stout
text: I absolutely loved this place!!!! I can’t wait to go back with more friends!!!! There are so many cool backgrounds and props!!! Megan was super friendly and helpful! I had the best time!!!! Don’t be afraid to go alone too cause they have selfie stands!!! They also have awesome lighting!!! Absolutely fantastic and fun!!!!

name: Chyna Chrisman
text: this place was so much fun! as soon as my boyfriend and i walked in we were immediately greeted by tracy i believe was her name! she was super helpful and kind! we will never forget this place! we also got some great shots that will last a lifetime :)

name: Mandie McArty Gosa
text: Wow! A bit pricey, but what a gem when you need a break from the sun! Generally, I would have not thought twice about a "Selphie Museum", however, coming across a few reviews during my search for things to do in Gulf Shores, we decided to give it a shot...and we were NOT disappointed! We could have stayed for HOURS if we allowed ourselves. We had 3 adults with two 12 yr old boys, one 10 yr old boy, and an 8 yr old girl. We ALL had a blast!!

name: Mallorie Brunswig
text: My boyfriend and I went and we had an amazing time!!! There are so many different places to take pictures and cool background. Good for all ages. I definitely would go back if I lived closer. Megan (the manager) was happy to help with anything we needed and gave us great tips. I definitely recommend!

name: Jasmine Morley
text: This place is so much fun! Worth the price and definitely would go back!

name: Morgan Daniels
text: My family had so much fun!!! Even if you don’t want to be in the photos you can take them of your kids , spouse , friends for free!! Price isn’t bad if you want to be in the photos ... they even did a bonus family picture at the end of your tour . All the props were great !!!! The lighting was Amazing! Be on the lookout for the cutest dog in the world, he enjoyed being a prop in our photos as well ! All around my whole family loved it .

name: Amber Morris
text: Awesome little adventure with the kids. We saw it while riding through The Wharf, and it turned out to be really fun! I highly recommend as something to engage all ages and I'd definitely do it again.

name: Jodi Kershner
text: We had so much fun at this place. Stopped here while on vacation in Gulf Shores. They had so many unique sets to take pictures in. Owner was very friendly and we even got pictures with his dog. The girl at the front was helpful and great with the kids. This was definitely money well spent!

name: Melanie Berman
text: This place was so much fun! It’s great to go in the morning when no one is there. Meagan was very helpful and we had a great time.

name: Sarah Redding
text: Had a blast here!! So many cool rooms and photo ops. There’s even a dog that came and took some selfies with me. Regret not asking her name, but the blonde girl working the desk was incredibly friendly and helpful, and went out of her way to show us around and give us good tips. An experience I will never forget!

name: Lily D
text:
This was such a fun experience! The owner and the workers were so sweet and helpful. We had so much fun, and each set was really well done! Our photos turned out great!!!
I would say though my only complaint was that, while each set had a ringlight, they didn’t all have a way to hold the phone up for you. Not a big deal tho!

name: Bryan King
text: I had no idea this place would be as cool as it was when I first paid for it! I thought it would be pretty lame and I thought I was doing it just for my young preteen daughter. But… It was a blast. I got some great photos that we will have the rest of our life. Jennifer was amazing! I would put this on the list of things you MUST do in Orange Beach!

name: Stormy Hubbard
text: My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary in town and saw this place. We popped in to see what it was about and spent nearly 2 1/2 hours taking pictures of each other. We laughed so much and got some great shots of each other. So much fun !!!

name: Allison Bishop
text: My visit was awesome. Went as a group made it very fun. Jennifer handled every question we had with patience and a wonderful smile. Absolutely recommend this fit fun time and great memories

name: Kristen Gryzik
text: Went to Cool Shots for the first time today for my Tiktok obsessed daughter just had to go. Not only were each set unique they were well put together. Upon checking in we were given a warm welcoming from the owners sweet pups, a light stick to use while there and a demo. Each set had its own ring light. The owner came out and spoke to us a few times and the staff was beyond sweet. Well worth the money and could see coming back to enjoy at a later date. My daughter is already asking when she can bring her friends.

resp.text: Sorry, we didn't get to finish our conversation.  I Like to talking to other business owners and learning a couple of things.  GREAT photo with Theo - he loves kids!!!!

name: emily benson .
text: Me and my friends recently went here this week, and it was amazing. The person that helped up was amazing and so sweet and patient. and the pictures came out awesome and there were so many different rooms!

name: Kiana Ross
text: I loved this place ! Amazing atmosphere and a wide variety of different booths. Jennifer and Megan were outstanding and made the experience even better. Definitely will be coming back soon.

name: Strawberry Fidgets
text: Very nice place! Jennifer helped us out there and she was very sweet and informative. The only reason I rated it 4 stars is bc they needed more amazing props added on  to the amount they have! 😊 💕

resp.text: 50’s not enough?  At end of summer, we’re gonna change some and add more!!

name: Olivia Hillman
text: My experience was Fantastic!! Everyone was so helpful and friendly. I met Jennifer at the front and she made us feel welcome immediately! The owner’s dog was so sweet and even took pictures with us!! I definitely recommend checking it out if you’re in the area!!!

name: kay giroir
text: On vacation to Gulf Shores and saw this in the things to do near me. It was pretty great! Not many people and amazing little photo rooms! I would definitely come back!

name: Gelisicia McElroy

name: Ben and Jen
text: Completely adore this new-ish restaurant.  Wonderful ambiance and kind-hearted staff.  The food is small plates, and worth every penny.  Too notch cocktails and a small but good wine selection.  Peaceful, quaint, well appointed old building with couches and coffee tables for a relaxing evening.  Just go.  You will love it

name: Keith Jackson
text:
This place has an upscale, yet casual feel.  The decor and finishings are very nice, yet they have TVs on the wall.  The service was great.  The staff seemed helpful and friendly, and everything was clean and well organized.

The food itself was very tasty.  All the plates (while small compared to the high priced) were creative, well presented, and delicious.  This is a tapas place, meaning you should expect small amounts of food that are a little overpriced.  The stuffed mushrooms, while great, maybe leaned into this idea a little too much.

Now to the cocktails.  The PB&J drink was surprisingly one of the best cocktails I've had.  The other drinks I had were above average for the area and price.

This place is new and definitely worth a visit or two.  The location is great and easy to get to from the highway, but the parking lot is absolutely terrible.

Come here if you need a break from the 10,000 "look how unique we are" hipster breweries around town.  Would certainly go again.

text: Wheelchair Accessibility is minimal.  You can get in the building but there is an upstairs area and even a portion of the main meeting area that is not accessible. People who use chairs do go to parties, bridal and baby showers too.  I was disappointed with the venue for the shower that I paid a rather large sum of money to help host. text: Walked in to a decent atmosphere, pleasant enough staff, but we waited for 40 minutes for two small orders. I got half of what was ordered, my girlfriend didn't even get hers. And we wound up getting a refund and leaving. Short staffed or no they could have warned us, we wasted an entire afternoon and got nothing for it. Don't eat here. It was just bad.

text: Good food, ok prices, fast service, great deserts, and even have take home meals. Take home meals are great being a college student because it's enough to feed me all week. Stop by at least once a week now.

name: Destiny L
text:
I am a long time customer of Camile's, not because of the food, but because it is right next door to campus. I sometimes like to sit and grab a bite between classes. The food is bit bland, but I have never had any problems with my order. One day I did and was treated horribly for the complaint. I ordered the Camile club with no mayo. When I received my sandwich, it had mayo. So, I calmly went back up and explained that I didn't want mayo. I was told it could be fixed.

While waiting on my sandwich, I noticed the staff watching me and speaking quietly, but I ignored it. 5 minutes later I was called back and when I went to check my sandwich again, I noticed the residue from mayo. It looked as if someone had wiped the mayo off and changed the bread. Again, calmly, I went back up (once again noticing the staff snickering) and asked to speak to the manager for a refund. Said-manager whose name I couldn't get, claimed she was there the whole time they "remade" my sandwich and it was fresh. I told her that couldn't be the case because it was now cold, it took her less time to make it than originally and I showed her a piece of lettuce that had mayo in it.

She then rudely asked me if I still had my receipt, which I did. I was given a refund, but I don't appreciate the way I was treated. If I'm paying for a meal, I expect it to made the way I requested it. I didn't ask them to make me a sandwich befitting God. I just didn't want mayo.  I am never stepping foot into that cafe again.

text: I had my wedding here in October and this venue "rustic yet elegant" is exactly as described. Comfortable, relaxed, yet beautifully decorated and very well designed. The staff are the best around to work with and are extremely knowledgeable as event planners. The venue is constantly being expanded with new cabins and facilities to make your wedding truly amazing. It has a perfect laid back vibe and flexibility to host not only weddings, but other events also. I highly recommend this place. 5 starts without hesitation. Photo credits: Pinks Snazzy Snapshots

name: Becca Bott
text:
Great venue style, nice country rustic chic. Downsides to my experience: While trying to reschedule dates, I was never notified that there would be any additional charges (per the owner), then when a date was picked for my grandparents anniversary party, he told another person in my family that we would have to pay extra (when the entire venue, lighting, and DJ were paid in full for $2700), then when confronted, the owner would leave my messages on read. We ended up not even using the venue, and of course everything was labeled "non-refundable" since it was all paid in full before canceling. Yes, I know that is what I signed in the contract (which had a lot of misspelling/miswording) but they just got $2700 from us for nothing. I'll probably end up picking a better venue for my future wedding unless the owner wants to resolve this issue.

Update: Since I can't directly reply, my family member canceled way more than 1 week in advance DUE TO COVID. And so we're the other cancelations and I have PROOF. We paid $2700 to get NO service. We weren't donating to your charity. And I had tried to contact you and you only put me on read and never replied. The reason we all sign a contract saying whatever is paid is non-refundable because he goes ahead and cashes it to make renovations as soon as he gets the money.

resp.text: Mrs Bott, you have rescheduled multiple dates which we have changed for you for free when we could have booked other weddings on those dates, then when you wanted to reschedule for the third time for your grandparents anniversary vow renewal we held that date also for you guys, then a week before that date a family member called to also cancel that. We can’t hold dates for free or no one would be in business. I’m sry things didn’t work out on your behalf, best of luck in the future.

name: Matthew Jungling
text:
Shocco Springs is an amazing camp center. I had the ability to go when our youth camp decided to come for summer camp. The camp is run through Student Life Camps and has an amazing group of staff and individuals that help the camp run. The guys in our group including me stayed in Mount Moriah, which is one of the many lodging buildings available to stay in. The rooms were clean and fresh bedding was provided, although we brought our own. I opted to use the provided bedding. The rooms had two bunk beds for a maximum capacity of 4 people. The lower level of Mount Moriah (we stayed in the top level--a two story building) has a nice little lobby area with some chairs and a couch. Some guys in our group thought it would be funny to take the couch upstairs and place it in front of our leader's room. We returned the couch afterwards.

The rest of the camp was very beautiful and well kept. There were some lawn care professionals maintaining the grounds while we stayed.

The recreation area, known as the "Adventure Camp" was very nice. The pool was large enough for our group to comfortably play in, as well as others. A diving board added to the fun. The Tennis courts and Basketball courts were very nice and well kept, but you will need to bring your own tennis supplies, as they are not provided. There was a small "lake" on camp grounds, with paddle boarding, and some water inflatables. We did not decide to go on these as they cost an extortionate amount of $8 for 30 mins of play. Not worth it.

It would we worth nothing that everything is fairly spread apart and there are some very intense hills throughout, which took a toll on our legs and knees. Golf Cart rentals were available for $35/day, but we had too many in our group that it would cost too much, so we didn't do it.

The food service was very nice, the food tasted adequate and there was always a variety to choose from. It is a self serve food line, so you are free to eat what you choose. A nice addition is the unlimited complimentary Soft Serve Ice Cream available at each and every meal.

Overall I have to say Shocco Springs is one of my favourite camps that I've been to. Sure it's a little hot here in Alabama, but that's fine. Just bring some water, and going swimming can help tremendously.

-Matthew J., age 15 at time of writing. Visited From June 1-5, 2016. Home town: Abilene, TX.

text: As the venue is beautiful and well manicured it needs to be known that we were told the venue is home to some 20-25 free range cats daily and the  grounds are literally covered in cat feces, the flowerbeds smell of strong urine upon passing, and contrary to the contract that the animals will be placed inside during a ceremony there is no way to round up 25 cats timely. My daughters engagement pictures and  wedding pictures are full of cats in the ceremony, one cat literally walked down the isle in front of our daughter creating a laughing frenzy that took her aww moment from her as no one paid attention to her . One was cleaning it’s  bottom at the alter, some lying in food servers and eating off the quest tables and several dogs running thru the reception. We had  people holding cats under each arm to keep the cats out of pictures. The video of the wedding can not be heard over the barking of the rescue dogs and the owners personal dogs on the premises. The bridesmaids were constantly having to clean cat poop off their shoes. 🤢  The road to the venue is not paved and has become very rough as there is a large amount of logging going on around the venue at this time  (6-1-19). As I am an animal lover a formal venue is not the place to have a rescue and vice versa. There is only one bathroom for guest to use and it was not clean upon us arriving. I had to ask for it to be cleaned as it at hair around the urinal.  The inside of their carriage house which holds the kitchen had dirty floors and filth in the corners where it had not been cleaned well. I would not recommend this venue for any event which is formal or food being served. I also find it very interesting that any bad review on here can be challenged by a “google user” which is probably the owner trying to get their rating back up because if any of my family didn’t agree with me I can promise you they wouldn’t be coward enough to go on the Internet and post anonymously so there’s your proof they are pretty dishonest folks. And who would even care enough about one persons review enough to call them out on it 🙄 so come on “google user” throw your real name out there 🤣 and all anyone has to do to know I’m right is go out there and look and listen to all the animals.

Danclay farms do not cater food so if u happen to not get a drink U might want to contact the event Cordinator or the caterer.

Sorry u had a bad experience. Danclay farms is  well equipped to handle large events with over 400 plus people  and have never had an issue . And there are two bathrooms in the property .

name: Wendy McDonald
text:
My stepson and his new wife were married here about a month ago. This is a beautiful venue for a wedding and most importantly the bride and groom were very happy with their special day. The house and grounds are gorgeous and well maintained. The cottage behind the house that relatives rented was cute and seemed to have plenty of room for multiple people to stay comfortably. We had hoped to stay on the grounds as well, but the other rental was still pending inspections or approvals of some sort.

This location is a little out of the way of anything and doesn't have many choices for out of town guests to stay. Cell service cuts off out in the area, so make sure you have your map ready before you lose service.

resp.text: Hi Wendy!  I am not showing you as a registered guest with us.  May I ask why you gave us 4 stars please?  Are you sure you are reviewing the correct property?  Thanks!

name: Starla Roden
text: This place is amazing! You will be in awe of every room and its beauty. The staff that runs the venue is just as amazing as the venue itself! There was nothing that we needed that was not already provided. The attention to detail provided by Destinie made my daughter's wedding flawless. Thank you!

resp.text: Thank you Starla!  Thanks for taking the time to do this and we are SO happy you had such a great experience.  Hope y'all can come back again.  Dave, Ann, Destinie, Nick and Chris

name: Douglas Harris
text: Nice relaxing enjoyable weekend..will return

resp.text: Thank you Douglas!  Hope you can come back again.

name: Patrick Steele
text: Beautiful venue...bathroom amenities could use some work.

resp.text: Hi Patrick and thanks for the five stars!  I didn't recognize your name right off, so I looked in all the reservations to see when you stayed and didn't see your name anywhere.  I can only assume you came as part of a group.  I was looking because I was wanting to respond to the comment but don't have chronology.  I wanted you (and the public reading this) to know that we have added two sparkling new full bathrooms on the main level and they are gorgeous.  The only other thing I could think of was the upstairs hall bath leaking to the lower floor.  We have discovered it only happens once in a while and in those cases the guests didn't put the shower curtain inside the shower.  So mystery solved AND we ordered glass sliding doors for that shower/tub combo to make it virtually leak-roof.  Hoping that clears anything up about "bathroom amenities needing work".  To the public reading reviews: this property is well maintained and we have no current issues with bathrooms.  They are all stocked with body wash, shampoo and conditioner.  We even have bar soap and the towels are fluffy and smell amazing.  Thanks Patrick for bringing the possibility of needing improvement as we strive to continuously achieve that.  Hope you will come back again.  Dave

text: Great camping fun and the cabins are great as well!  We love it every time we go. Great staff! Have been multiple times and it never disappoints. Plenty of fish in the ponds, the waterslide is great fun and we love the ability to rent the golf carts! Also, the military discount is an awesome plus!

name: Becky Rautenstrauch
text: My husband, myself and friends had a wonderful time. What a fantastic get away. We loved everything about The Kick Back Ranch.  We could be busy, or just Kick Back . We will definitely put  this vacation spot at the top of our list as our Favorite. Definitely we  will all be back. Get yourself ready to be very pleased at the Kick Back Ranch.

name: Tammy Barnes
text: This place is beautiful! The owner and staff were so very nice and helpful! A lot to do or just kickback and relax. We are already planning another trip very soon. Thanks to Mindi and all her staff for a great time.

name: Laura Coker
text: Kick Back Ranch is very special to our family. We discovered this beautiful, family oriented Ranch last year. The first time we went, I knew we fell in love. The facility is beautiful and well kept. The owners and all staff were so helpful and kind. My kids love it so much they have their birthday parties at kick back. We enjoy the special events they host. It truly is an amazing family owned and loved hidden treasure. I highly recommend this place for too many reasons to list. We look forward to our time their.

name: Jerry Myer
text: We had a blast. Slides were fun, pool was clean, the beach was neat and all the little cabins are as cozy as can be. Rent or bring your own golf cart. Cute little store with what  nots, DG and diner close by. There are full time residents there and owners/staff protect their privacy; understand this before you go. If your a respectable natured human being, this will NOT be an issue. Gym on site. Laundry, game room, basketball courts, playgrounds, canoes and paddle boats...all this will keep your kids busy for the weekend. Event center surrounded by cabins  and sidewalks. Looks like a neat venue to have family reunions, weddings or parties. Rv park does lack shade and a little close but the second park (under construction) may have better spacing. Too much to do to stay in the camper anyway. We will be back...our kids did not wanna leave.

name: Amanda Boswell
text: Didn't realize such a great vacation spot was so close to home. Loved our stay and even better, the kids barely picked up their phones all wkend! I can't believe there is anyone crazy enough to leave a poor reviews of this place. Will definitely be going back.

name: Samantha Green
text:
The security guard ruined our entire trip. We had to wear wristbands the entire time. Felt like a prison camp more than a “vacation.” We ended our trip after just one night. We used to go all the time but things have changed. We will never be back and will tell everyone not to go.

We were called on our first night and was told not to drive the golf carts off the gravel for the first half of the day the next day since it rained. Okay, fair enough. So at about 11:45, we drove our cart off the gravel and onto a trail close to one of the first ponds in the place. It was about mid day. The ground was dry. We get our keys taken away while out on the water. We watched the security guard take them. We went to the office to complain and he called us liars saying the owner said the full day.

We had dogs there and where we were staying, there was a fence. We let the dogs out of the car and into the fence, and we got yelled at by the security guard because they were not on a leash. We asked why because they were in a closed fence? His response… ON A LEASH!!!! No explanation. A stray dog came up to us later that day and he came up red in the face screaming at us because she wasn’t on a leash. We explained that it wasn’t our dog and he didn’t care.

This is the most backwards place to stay. It feels more like a prison. Do not go here ever. You couldn’t pay me to stay here. The owners are letting this security guard play Jail House instead of watching for suspicious or dangerous situations. I think his name is Fred. Fred needs to be fired.

name: Johnny Tadlock
text: Kick Back Ranch is a new campground with a nice water slide for kids and adults but unless you are a resident of Kick Back you will not get the best of sites to park on and will not have access to their public pool. They make you wear a colored wrist band while camping which identifies you as a part time camper. Hint don't wear the wrist band and you may be able to get into areas for full timers... Gravel RV spots were in full sun (no shade). We asked if we could get a shady spot when we made the reservations but were told those are for residents of the park. Spots 4-15 are so close together, your common area (normally right side of camper) was right next to your neighbors sewer/septic connection. You smell septic the whole time you are sitting outside. Very bad set-up. I hope they do something about this. Ponds are all over the property (huge property) but they are very dirty and not very fishing friendly. Too much growth around the edges when trying to fish off the bank. You will lose worms, lures, etc.

name: Reginald Fowler
text: I just left a family  Reunion this past weekend at the Ranch and let me tell you I had a blast.The property  is well maintained  and everyone  is friendly  and helpful.  Its only  one thing  that bothers  me is that there is no stocked fish in the lakes. I live in Mobile and I fish alot.  I tried fishing  there and didn't  get one nibble. Other than the unstocked  lakes everything  else  was almost perfect.  Oh and I didn't get a golf cart due to so many rented out. Definitely  will recommend  this place.

name: Lindsay Beard
text: LOVE this place and the owners are top notch! Great place for a little get away or a day of fun. They have several public events often and try not miss any!!!

name: Jessica Sherrill
text: We love Kick Back Ranch. We have visited many times and it has been friendly, peaceful and inviting each time. We will be back for sure!

name: Kalonni Jackson
text: Kickback Ranch is nice very nice but the staff are rude, prejudice, & just unprofessional. Fred was VERY RUDE & the supervisor backed him up with out a single apology. The Owners reached out just to have the same vibe....I pray things get better .

name: Lisa Neafus
text:
My husband, I and our service dog lived here for 8 months. In short, a couple moved in wanting our spot. They kept calling the owners on us with untruthful accusations. The wife kept talking to me one morning while I was trying to load my car for work. I asked her to please just leave me alone. She would not stop. I just kept loading my stuff and asked again to leave me alone. The next day I get a call from Mindy, the owner while at work and she let's in on me with several slanderous accusations. She tells me my dog must be removed from the property by that night and if we do not comply, she will call the sheriff. Not once did she ever discuss anything with me prior to this day. I tell you Mindy is the most unprofessional person I have ever met. Talk about accused, charged and found guilty without a trial. We never had words with anyone or were ever warned by the owners. I assure you, the ones who did what we were accused of is still there!!!! My husband did have a civil conversation two days before with the owner's husband and thought they had an understanding. ????I must take this moment to thank Mindy because I did not like her from the first time I met her. We LOVE our new home. We have LOTS of water pressure!!!! I mean my Dawn makes bubbles in the sink!!!! FREE WI-FI!!!!!!! Mindy advertises free wi-fi.  What a joke. We have a foot more room inside our motorcoach. The power was so low there we couldn't get them to slide completely out!! Every time I cooked there I flipped a breaker. We can use all my appliances at one time now!!!! We have grass and a picnic table. Clyde, our service dog, is welcome and has a huge field he can run in. The owners are so kind and welcoming. Our first night here in our new rv park  the owner said they close at six but come on back, he'd be drinking a beer on the front porch and so we joined him!!! The good lord has blessed us with some great friends from Kick Back and I hope we never lose touch. Thank those who loved and accepted us and Clyde. We will never forget your blessings on us.

I failed to mention the owner, Mindy showed up on our lot as soon as my husband got home from work (the same day i received a call at work from Mindy with her accusations)with the park manager and the security  guard carrying an assault rifle!!!!! Really???!  OMG!! We basically kept to ourselves but welcomed anyone that stopped by. We never were even talked to before this day!!!! Just can't wrap my head around such cruel and ridiculous tactics from Mindy.

name: Julia Taylor
text:
My kids love the water slide but the owners an security guard is awful
I would love to visit again only with new owners.they are not friendly people.the ones in the office were very nice and i hate the lil kids couldn't get in the poil

text: Granddaughter had a wonderful 13th birthday at Kickback. The facilities are excellent and the setting is absolutely beautiful. Cabins, cottages, camping RV facilities, exercise room, pool, VB, BB, hiking, fishing, waterslide, game room, fishing . . . and more. Price is reasonable and staff go above and beyond to accommodate their guests. Easy access off 331, and the facility is gated. You won't be disappointed.

name: Brittney Anderson
text: This venue is amazing! I just had my wedding here and the owners told us when we were first visiting that their primary goal was to make it a stress free day for everyone involved and they accomplished that exceedingly well! Their day of coordinator and DJ were also a pleasure to work with and made everything come together exactly the way we wanted. We moved our ceremony inside because of weather, but they allowed us to make that decision day of and flipped everything between the ceremony and reception flawlessly. Everything was beautiful. Everyone you will work with here knows what they're doing and knows how to do it well. And seriously- no stress. for anyone. even with a tropical storm rolling through. I highly recommend this venue to anyone looking for a perfect wedding day!

name: Alexander Manning
text: They're very nice and great to deal with. If I could have another wedding I would definitely do it again. Highly recommend!

text: It was a great 4th of July Celebration , the band was great , the food was good , I really liked checking out  the Vendors that were there also , thank you Leigh Acres for all the great entertainment  you brought to us , it was fabulous 😁💯

name: Natalee Benjamin
text: Stayed at the Air BNB at Leigh Acres while traveling with my family and it’s just the cutest! The three bedroom lodge was so cozy and well decorated with fun and interesting art. All of the art on each of the buildings on the property is SO COOL. We took the kids out for a walk on the property, where we saw there are pigs, ducks, and other animals on the farm. I will definitely be coming back for one of their events in New Market, they have a music stage built and the speaker system looks like it rocks! There was even a playground on the property which made it that much more fun. Plus, they are dog friendly, so we were able to bring our dogs to run around and there is a fenced in back yard at the house, which was perfect.

resp.text: Thank you so much Natalee! Leigh Acres enjoys being the go to place in New Market for exciting events, a comfortable place to stay, and an all around great time!

name: Brian Hall
text: Had the pleasure of DJing at Leigh Acres for Halloween. This place is amazing. There were food truck, a hunted experience and so much more.  Great open space for music events. Thanks for having us.

resp.text: Thank YOU Brian. We enjoyed the event and look forward to the next big thing at Leigh Acres!

resp.text: Thank you Dylan! Leigh Acres is the place to be for events, arts and entertainment in New Market and we are glad you enjoyed a visit here.

name: Veronica Ferguson
text: This establishment is exceptional. The location is in historic Evergreen, Alabama with access to many amenities you might need during your visit/stay.  The interior is designed with a mixture of past antiques and modern high-end elegance.  Some of the furnishings include works of art you would see in a musem.  The rooms are nicely furnished and comfortable.  The grounds are well manicured, including areas that could be used for outside events.  This location can be used for group meetings.  Absolutely stunning.

name: Autumn Stepp
text: Hosted our wedding at Infinity, and I truly cannot say enough good things about this venue! In addition to being absolutely gorgeous (which is a huge plus if you're like me and don't want to put a lot of effort into decorations...the venue is so beautiful by itself that we really didn't need a lot of decorations!), Aubrey and her team are truly a dream to work with. They were with us every step of the way to get us ready for the big day, and then they were there the day of to make sure everything went smoothly. My husband and I stayed in the honeymoon suite at the venue, and it was sooooo nice not to have to drive anywhere after the reception!  We got to hang out with our loved ones even longer! All in all, I would recommend Infinity to anyone looking for an even venue!

text: I live in Muscoda and  I would not use that building If it was free Its sad that you  let a perfectly good building go to waste other communities have centers and they have all types of programs  for their community They have had grants and monthly stipends to fix or  improve it nothings has been done.  The bathroom is not working as well is a sad situtation to  let such a nice building go to waste. I went there when it was Addison Elementary and now its just a storage for JUNK... I hope something will be done before it is a eyesore   The grass is always over grown  until something in the park is known or when they are just trying to impress someone  the Muscoda Improvement Association should be ashamed  because they aren't doing anything to improve our community.

name: Teri Easterling
text: Our daughter selected Venue 3131 for her wedding and reception. From setting the date in June 2020 through the wedding day 6/26/21 the staff has been responsive and helpful. They enjoy what they do and do it well. The setting is lovely and versatile. The chapel is air conditioned. The studio opens up, and strategically placed fans kept us comfortable as the sun went down. They give access to a room full of decorations. Daughter opted to leave some of hers, so the staff handled take down for us. Rehearsal dinner set up was in the arbor terrace that was quite pleasant. Chris and Holly and crew are excellent! I have attended some other events there that were well done also.

resp.text:
Hi Teri, thanks for posting some photos from your daughters wedding.  We were fortunate to be able to work with her and Tyler and this wedding was so fun and unique!  WE LOVED IT!

We are thankful that we have very responsive, and accommodating staff that always go above and beyond. We hope to see you again at more events in the future!

resp.text: Thanks guys!  It was great having you out to DJ!  We can't wait to see you all again out at the Venue!

name: Courtney Nolan
text: Venue 3131 is amazing!!!!! We had our wedding here a few weeks ago and all I can say is wow! Chris and Holly were great to work with and helped us so much throughout the planning process! We had different venue booked but they canceled on us with 2 months to spare. We came across Venue 3131 and they swooped right in and saved the day! I keep saying that we ended up way better off in the end. Every staff member was so attentive and caring and the venue is truly beautiful. Our wedding weekend was absolute pure magic from rehearsal dinner to send off. We can’t thank Chris, Holly, and staff enough! Seriously if you’re needing a venue for any event Venue 3131 is the place to go!

resp.text: Hi Courtney, we are so glad that our paths crossed!  Although it was in tough circumstances with last minute changes from your prior wedding venue.   We are glad we were able to (save the day- literally) and accommodate you and Michael.  We hope that we were able to help make your wedding even better than you had imagined!  Thanks again for the review and we hope to see you two again in the future!

name: Paul Iwanaga
text: Very friendly and helpful staff. Cute little wedding venue.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to take photos, and post them, we really appreciate you.  We had a blast at Matt and Melody's Rehearsal dinner and wedding, and look forward to out next event with them.  Enjoy your time here in Birmingham and safe travels back home.  Thanks again for the review.

text: Attended a wedding at venue 3131, very elegant venue. Nice chapel, very peaceful courtyard with fountain, and several other beautiful areas to just walk/stroll through and enjoy the ambience! Didn't even know this place existed right in the middle of Hueytown. The staff was very courteous and helpful!! Should a woman ever actually decide to marry me, I'll be calling venue 3131

name: Brian Reaves
text: This is an incredibly beautiful venue capable of just about any wedding scenario. Their outdoor area is like something out of a movie with the vines covering it, and their indoor area is spacious and clean. They even have the perfect spot for the reception right there on the grounds with rolling doors to allow for indoor or outdoor receptions. The owners are incredibly nice people who really want to make the event special.

name: Trupti Shinde
text:
Good ice cream and good customer service as well.. we loved chocolate and Oreo mixed .. 💯😍 but raspberry is quite average .. rates are absolutely fine 💯👍🏻
Cafe is very clean and comfortable seating.

Definitely recommend

name: Opal Hall
text: Having the grilled cheese! They have soup and some other options. For winter they have different latte and hot cocoa options. Beautiful colors and location. Lots of treats and cute little gifts. They’re having a birthday party here at the moment. It was kind of out of our way, so I will probably go to the original location, but it seems like a nice spot.

name: Beth C
text: Very friendly and knowledgeable staff. They can have gluten free cupcakes available with a little notice! The macarons are beautiful, and they have ice cream and sorbet. You need to stop by!

resp.text: Thank you Beth!

name: Erin Shockey
text:
I wish i could give Dreamcakes Cafe a million star review! Wow! I visited Dreamcakes Cafe with my mother and sister for afternoon tea. It was such a special day for us because we planned afternoon tea right before they accompanied me to shop for my wedding dress! The staff knew this and were so excited, kind, and encouraging.

We made our tea selections a few days before our event via email. Kallie was wonderful about responding on email. We had to sign a contract prior to the tea and she made it very easy to do so. When we arrived to the cafe, our tea table was set up with everything we needed: teacups, utensils, saucers, even fresh flowers! The set up was stunning and the food was delicious! I highly recommend the pimento cheese sandwich with peach jam and the macarons!!

During the tea, the wait staff made us feel so special. Someone was always by to ensure we had everything we needed, refill cups, etc and all of them were SO polite, friendly, and knowledgable about tea selections. My sister had a gluten and dairy allergy and they made sure she knew what she could and couldn't eat and even brought out a special cup of chicken salad for her.

Thank you Dreamcakes staff! You made this such a special day for us. The thought and time you put into the details of our tea was noticed and SO appreciated. It was perfect from start to finish. Hope to see yall again soon... we will be back!!

resp.text:
Thank you so much Erin! It was such a pleasure working with you. We really enjoyed serving you during your tea and are so happy that you enjoyed it so much! We are pleased to accommodate all allergies and love that we were able to find the best solution for your sister. We love going above and beyond for you customers! We look forward to seeing you in the future!

- Dreamcakes Cafe Staff

name: Kathy McLaurin
text: Good cupcakes! Was a little upset that I asked for a wedding cake cupcake and after arriving home, realized they gave me a vanilla cupcake instead. I’m not a fan of plain vanilla anyway, but I didn’t finish it- the frosting had a slight “soap” taste to it. For $5 a cupcake I’m not sure it was worth it. However, I loved the other flavors provided! My advice: don’t get the vanilla, and make sure you check to make sure you pay for the cupcakes you actually want! I would have gone back, but they were already closed and it’s a 15 minute drive from where I live.

name: eledda gmail
text: Had an apple cider, brownie and muffin. None of them was too sweet, which is a great plus for me. Great quality of the ingredients, tasted like it is homemade. They deserve a 4.5 grade

name: Elaine Adams
text: IT IS SO CUTE!! you have to stop and try something from here. I got the peaches and cream cupcake and it couldn't have been better.

resp.text: Elaine! thank you so much for your "sweet" review and we are thrilled you like our new store. We try really hard to make it a great experience when you come. We are always adding new flavors each month. Look forward to seeing you soon!

text: Love the cupcakes but horrible customer service. My boyfriend brought me a gift card that he purchased off their website ( not third party site but Dreamcakes site). When I went to purchase my cupcakes, I showed the guy my gift card. He told me that I couldn’t use it because that wasn’t their gift card. He stated he would know because he was the manager. I explained to him that I had used a few weeks prior. Long story.. I ended having to pay and not be able to use my gift card.

text: This venue is big and very roomy. It's perfect for wedding receptions big company parties or any large event. Bathrooms are nice and clean and the bartenders are awesome!

text: Beautiful location for a wedding reception or other event. Very spacious. Has 2 bars and fits hundreds of people. Also the venue had live music inside, which you couldn't hear outside. Seriously great location.

text: Great location. Very spacious and I can see that it could very easily divided for multiple events. Limited cocktails at the bar. It I would think most events would have their own specialty cocktails. Ice cubes are perfect 3/4” cubes which is great to chill the drink without watering it down. But they have no glasses — plastic only. When I was here there was a band performing but the sound wasn’t very good; fairly distorted if you are in areas of the venue not directly in front of the band.

name: james gibbs
text: Great event space. Please work/invest  on acoustics if you hope to continue with events that feature live music. Great experience.

text: Great venue. Lots of open space, good for large crowds. They are sticklers for rules, they have pages of them, you'll want to read them all, and assume nothing (ie things like dumpsters).

text: I did the videography for a wedding here a little over a month ago and had a really good experience. The Haven has a very industrial feel that lends itself great to the feel of Birmingham as a city. The staff that I had interaction with were all super friendly and helpful. The valet drivers were also very organized and seemed genuine. The main area has ample room for quite a bit of seating as well as a sizable dancefloor and DJ platform. The bride seemed extremely happy with the service she received here and my experience was also a resounding positive.

text: This venue and the owners are terrific!! I highly recommend this beautiful location for your wedding site!! My daughter got married there in May of 2021 and it was perfect.
