name: Steve Stanley
text: Enjoyed the lunch special at Jockers today.  Excellent curries.  I love their Indian dishes so I haven't tried the American dishes. Service was fast and courteous.  The atmosphere is great for a business meeting or dining with friends.

resp.text: Great choice of having authentic Indian dishes. We are open for lunch from 11am to 2pm and dinner from 4pm until 9pm and Friday/Saturday 10pm. Sunday 12-5pm. We have two cuisines American and Indian. We provide courteous, friendly and fast service in a relaxing atmosphere with quality, fresh and value for money meals. The restaurant offers signature drinks and cocktails.We cater for all types of guests- business , family, reunion, meetings, casual and groups. Thank you for your business.

name: Cynthia Payne
text: It was delicious and fast. Not very many customers so waitress was very attentive and knowledgeable of the menu except that I ordered a salad and they were not taking orders for salads.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. Pleased you enjoyed your meal in a great atmosphere with fast and friendly service. All our staff are trained to know our menu items and explain to our valuable guests. Salads are presently not available.

name: Jay O
text: The food was outstanding, the service was on point. It was refreshing to eat a quality meal. The staff is great...always checking on ya...owner was exceptional...visited and made sure food was delicious.  Very clean.

resp.text: Awesome. Thank you for your five star rating. We strive for excellence with every dish served and guest. We ensure that our dishes are prepared freshly per order. Your are absolutely right about our employees- friendly, polite, attentive, helpful with every guest. We appreciate your business.

name: Visaboy M.
text: I only experienced their Philly Fries and some type of desert. Philly Fries were amazing. Not very expensive.

resp.text: Appreciate your review. Loaded Philly Fries are our signature dish. Very popular with our valuable guests. We offer variety of deserts that our guests order after have a delicious meal. Thank you for visiting our restaurant.

name: Hunter Waldman
text: My wife, a friend, and I went to try the Indian Cuisine at Jokers for Lunch today. It was excellent. I love Indian food and am a tough critic, but it was the best Indian I’ve ever had. Rick came out and talked with us (great guy) and we’ve been begging the Shoals area to get an Indian restaurant. Super pumped about this place and hoping to get them more visitors. If you are unsure of what to order, you cannot go wrong with Chicken Tika Massala. It’s a very “safe” first time order. Excellent food overall.

resp.text: Awesome! Thank you for your feedback. It was absolutely pleasure serving your party. Definitely Chicken Tikka Masala is favorite Indian cuisine around the world. Our chef cooks each meal per order, therefore, fresh quality ingredients and appetizing. We will extend our menu as business grows giving our valuable guests more choices to ensure we can meet their palate. We appreciate your loyalty.

name: Rikesh Patel
text:
Love the upscale feel and atmosphere with a great twist.

Their cocktails are great and the lighting is really cool around the bar area.

It is nice to know that there are different cuisine options in the Shoals.

Great draft beer options and entertainment. This will be a regular spot from now on.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. We appreciate your business. We offer Indian and American cuisine to suit every guests needs. We are pleased to do restaurant business in the Shoals area. Variety of cocktails, beer and music offered daily.

name: Sam Carpenter
text: Never been to a more funner place then this club. The bartender Jake gave me the best drinks and he was hilarious! He made my experience much more enjoyable we always take great care of him when we are there on saturdays. Every Saturday is a routine for me and the guys and this place has won me over

resp.text: We appreciate your loyalty to Jokers Bar and restaurant. We have variety of drinks and specialty cocktails. Jake is a wonderful bartender like rest of our team. He does create a great experience for our valuable guests. See you next Saturday. Thank you.

name: April De Luna
text: My husband and I went here to eat Indian food and that we did. We was so pleased with the waitress Bret is her name I believe. And the food was Awesome... We will absolutely be back time and time again. Thank you Chef Ram..

resp.text: Thank you for coming over to our Jokers restaurant. Absolutely our food is the finest in the area. Pleased you enjoyed your Indian dishes, which is very authentic. Your server Brett is very friendly, polite, helpful like rest of our valuable servers. We look forward to your next visit. We pass on your comments to Ram, chef.

name: Michelle Poston
text: We are from out of town visiting family, the butter chicken was good/ok. But, not much chicken, it was mostly sauce. Small portions of rice too.

resp.text: We appreciate you trying out our establishment for authentic Indian dishes. Our butter chicken is a very popular dish. Sorry you felt there was not enough chicken. We serve extra rice rice on request. We hope you visit us again and any concerns please let us know. Thank you for your business.

name: Beverly Emerson
text: Food Good and lots of space. Room outside and great dance

resp.text: Wonderful. Yes we have a great outdoor patio with a stage and 2 bars with plenty of seating facilities. Also there is enough space for people to enjoy the music and dance the night away! This all compliments our Indian/ American cuisine- great choices of freshly cooked dishes. Hope you enjoyed the band last night.

name: Melissa Littrell
text: First time at Jokers.  Food was great abd the music of Tremayne was awesome!  They need to be your house band!

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. Tremayne are an excellent band playing variety of popular songs. The crowd at Jokers had a great time listening and dancing to their music. As you mentioned we have awesome selection of food with American and Indian menu selections. We have live entertainment on Friday or Saturday check our Facebook page.

name: David Ellis
text: My wife and I love Indian cuisine, and this is excellent and authentic! We have had been searching for a place since the good one in Madison closed.

resp.text: Thank you for your visit to Jokers to eat our delicious Indian meal. We are glad to bring Indian cuisine to the Shoals. The menu consists variety of Indian delicacies. We appreciate your business.

name: Jake Miller
text: Great upscale atmosphere with the best bartenders in the 256! Owners and management are very friendly. Food is AWESOME. would highly recommend and would give 10 stars if it was a option!

resp.text: Wow… appreciate the valuable feedback. We have team of people from management to employees. They take care of each guest.

name: Larry Hardy
text: Great food and atmosphere definitely will go back. I recommend it to everyone. That have Indian and American food and both are amazing

resp.text: We look forward to your next visit to the Jokers serving both American and Indian cuisine. Our decor is very contemporary and unique. Thank you for your review.

name: Andy modi
text: Ordered Chicken Tikka 555 and it was an awesome experience. Joker reminded me of my good old days in India

resp.text: Wonderful! Chicken tikka 555 is a specialty dish created by our chef. It is a very popular dish. Pleased you enjoyed the Indian we have created with authentic Indian cuisine.

name: Brandy Massey
text: Something new & unique to the area with the Indian food! Good atmosphere & people that owns it! I do believe this business will last,and as a community we need to uplift these owners and employees so they will succeed! 😌😌

resp.text: Thank you for your support. Great food and ambiance. Yes we’re here to ensure we serve the community with delicious food with excellent service.

name: Tyler Foreman
text:
Both voodoo, and joker burgers are fantastic.
Fish & chips are bomb af.
Lamb Curry is everything.
Glad this place came to the shoals to bring some variety to the area.

resp.text: Wow wonderful you enjoyed variety of cuisine both American and Indian. Our burgers are specifically formulated for our restaurant. Fish and chip a great British tradition made fresh cod. Great with splash of malt vinegar. All our curries of great taste mainly chicken, lamb, fish or vegetables. Thank you for your business and hope to see soon.

name: Pace Forrest
text: Waitress was very nice and kept us taken care of. Food was well cooked and the building itself looks very nice.

resp.text: We have the finest team in the Shoals at Jokers. Our team are very friendly, polite and helpful with great service and food. Thank you for your business.

name: Garret Cox
text: Cool atmosphere, delicious food and drinks. On top of normal fare (burgers, etc) they have delicious indian cuisine! Try the chicken tikka masala and naan bread!

resp.text: Fabulous! Yes you are right Chicken Tikka Masala is a very popular authentic Indian dish made with creamy gravy with various spices. Our naan bread is cooked freshly in tandoor ( clay oven)- you can have plain, butter, garlic/butter or chilly naan, choice is yours. Our signature burger is Jokers Burger specially created by our chef. We appreciate your business. Thank you.

name: Austin Lee
text: I cant leave a biased opinion on the establishment. The reason i am biased is i really dont have the liking for indian food. But they do have other options. Worth the try if u do like the food

resp.text: Yes you are correct we have 2 cuisines- American and Indian cuisine. The choice is yours. Thank you for your feedback.

name: John Chase
text: I rounded up my family and came here for lunch today based on this web page and the sign out front showing that they should be open.  The place looked closed, no cars, and no one answered the phone.  I was disappointed.  But,  the manager called me later to explain they were open but he was in the back and had no customers yet so they looked closed.  I will try again soon and try the door even if they look closed!

resp.text: We are open today 11am to 9pm. Everyday we are open Tuesday to Thursday 11am to 9pm, Friday and Saturday close at 10pm . Sundays 12pm-6pm. Closed on Mondays. These are restaurant times. Hope to see you at these opening times. Our management spoke to you earlier. Thank you.

name: Ryan Swindle
text: Very nice new restaurant in our area. Lots of variety on the menu.

resp.text: Absolutely newest restaurant in the Shoals area. We cater for all authentic Indian and American cuisine in a great atmosphere. Thank you for your patronage.

name: Michelle White
text: Affordable and delicious. One of the best burgers I've ever had.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. Our burgers are the best in the Shoals. We have our signature Jokers Burger - very popular with our guests. Great food at affordable prices.

name: ALEX P
text:
Exceeds Expectation!

Meat and veggies freshness and quality guaranteed, ingredients and spices adequate quantity, superb menu instructions and result, tasty and satisfying, excellent and prompt customer service!!!

resp.text: Excellent five stars rating! We appreciate your business. We serve both American and Indian cuisine at highest quality and freshness. We have many  of dishes choices for every consumer palate. All our team members provide finest service in the restaurant/ bar industry.

name: Martin Dean
text: We have Indian food in the Shoals! WOOHOO! it was very good, the Samosas were divine, Chicken Curry, off the chain. Go, expand your horizons!

resp.text: Yes we’re are glad to bring Indian cuisine to the Shoals. Glad we made your choice of palate. We offer variety of dishes.

name: Jacob Hodgson
text: I can't attest to the atmosphere, but the Lamb Vindaloo that I just got for lunch take-out is worth the five stars on its own.

resp.text: Great. Pleased that you enjoyed your lamb vindaloo- obviously you enjoy hot spicy dish. You should try our popular dish of chicken tikka Masala. Thank you for your your take-out order.

name: Deanna Jackson
text: Amazing food great service. We have been there many tine

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. We sincerely appreciate your continued support by frequently coming to our Jokers restaurant/bar. We certainly have amazing food and great selection on our menu.

name: Timothy James
text: Nice place.  Great food and friendly staff.

resp.text: Glad you enjoyed your food and service at Jokers. We offer variety of American and Indian cuisine. Our staff are absolutely friendly and polite.

name: Allison Mackey
text: Went on a Friday night for dinner. We had cocktails, the vegetable samosas, veggie curry, chana masala (chickpeas), and gulab jamun. STELLAR food. Hopefully the service will improve (took a very very very long time to get our food.) Also looking forward to the full Indian menu availability. I appreciated that Indian music was playing as we ate. Super friendly staff. Will eat here again!

resp.text: Thank you for your review. Our Indian menu is very highly recommended by our valuable guests like yourself. We will be extending our menu in the near future. We apologize for delay in serving your meal. We cook fresh food, so it takes time to prepare and execute. Appreciate your business.

name: Terri Whalen
text: The food was awesome - veg samosas, chicken 555, shrimp pakora, saag paneer, chicken curry, - all excellent! Garlic nan was very flavorful.  The mixed drinks were exceptional.  The raita was a bit thin for my preference but had great flavor.  Rice was perfect. They are still working from a limited menu so looking forward to going back again to try some other dishes.  So happy to have Indian as a local option - it is one of our favorite cuisines and we always had to travel to get it.  (We did have a rather long wait time to get our food but I think that is reflective of a new venture...I’m sure they will work out the kinks with time.)  Definitely recommend for great Indian good.

resp.text: Fantastic 5 stars review. We offer variety of Indian cuisine. Pleased you enjoyed your dishes ordered. Thank you for your understanding of delay in food. Our naans are freshly made in tandoor. All our meals are made freshly, cooked to order. We look forward to seeing you on your next visit.

name: Timothy Whalen
text:
The food here is excellent. It's at least as good as any Indian food I've had in Nashville, Birmingham, or Huntsville. The chicken 555, vegetable samosas, and shrimp pelota we're tasty and well prepared. Saag Paneer, Chicken Curry, and Lamb Korma had delightful subtle flavors. The meats were succulent. Gulab Jamun was chewy on the outside creamy on the inside in a sweet but not cloying honey sauce.
The reason for only four stars is they are new so it took a long time for the food to come out, the servers didn't know the menu very well, and they seemed confused. Once they get their systems running more smoothly they'll be 5 starts for sure!

resp.text: Thank you for your visit to Jokers to try out our Indian cuisine. We serve variety of appetizers, entrees and desserts. Our meals are cooked fresh and takes time to delivery to your table. We look forward to your next visit.

name: Sonia Patek
text: Very friendly place. Love Indian food. Everything is extravaganza❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback. It was a pleasure serving you with authentic Indian cuisine. Pleased you enjoyed our friendly service, great atmosphere, delicious Indian food and ambiance.

name: Markesha Hackett
text: Go get you a Mother Clucker Chicken sandwich or fish and chips!!! Omg sooooo good!

resp.text: Yes it is gray choices of meals. Fish and Chips is very popular. Thank you for your feedback.

name: Kennedy English
text: Service is slow and management seems indifferent. Alcohol was served to obviously patrons that were clearly to inebriated to drink more.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. Our food is cooked fresh therefore may take slightly longer to deliver to your table. Very confusing about management comment, we get compliments on our management interaction with our valuable guests. Every individual has there own tolerance on consumption of alcohol, we do not control people’s habits!

name: Keith Cantrell
text: Great food, great atmosphere, nice service! Gotta check out the live music!

resp.text: Wonderful. Thank you for your review. Glad you enjoyed your visit to our bar and restaurant. Check out our Facebook for live entertainment weekly.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. Excellent that you enjoyed your meal. Our facility offers great ambiance in a contemporary surroundings. We have very friendly, polite and helpful team members to serve you. Appreciate you coming to our restaurant/ bar.

name: Ron Almy
text: Although , not opened(opening is scheduled for March 15 )it'll contain a sports themed atmosphere, several bars and a family friendly restaurant with quality foods and an authentic        Indian style menu.

resp.text: We are open now with American and Indian restaurant with great cocktails, beer and music. Come and check us out.

name: Tamera Johnson
text: The music could have been better

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. Let us know on your next visit- suggestions on music of choice.

resp.text: We are the best!

resp.text: Absolutely we are here for longevity in the Shoals area.

resp.text: Sorry to hear about your visit. Usually food incidents occur after 24 hours of consumption. Hope you guys are doing well.

name: Heber Melendez
text: Had a great time there

resp.text: Thank you for visiting us at Jokers of the Shoals. Glad you enjoyed your time at our restaurant/ bar. Thanks for your five star review.

resp.text: Excellent. Appreciate you coming to Jokers for friendly and courteous service. We have both American and Indian menu. Thank you.

resp.text: We provide fabulous music and definitely food. Try out our menu for choice of Indian or American dishes.

resp.text: Superb 5 star rating. Absolutely very colorful decor and atmosphere. Appreciate your feedback.

name: D'Angelo Anderson
text: Great

resp.text: Thank you for your business. Appreciate you enjoyed your visit to the Jokers with Indian food.

name: Bernie Mettenberger
text: Finally, real Indian food in the Shoals. Tandoori Chicken was great. Margaritas were pretty good, but are the smallest I've seen.

resp.text: Great! Yes we are getting many new guests trying out Indian cuisine and others who have tried Indian food elsewhere before. Tandoor Chicken is cooked in a special Tandoor ( clay oven) with spices. This is a very popular appetizer dish. We have variety of beers including Kingfisher from India, domestic/ foreign and IPA beers, spirits, signature cocktails. Thank you for your patronage.

name: Patrick Kelly
text: Great place. Staff is awesome. I'm there almost every weekend

name: Jeepsalive1 katz
text: Trails for days.  Can't ride them all in a weekend I dont think.  Good mud..good hills...pretty views..

resp.text: Thank You for your review!! We are grateful and look forward to you coming back!!!

name: Amanda Kay Whiddon
text: We had a great time driving through the Christmas lights this year at Bana Slam.  Once we were done, we parked and bought smores and found our personal campfire complete with wooden log seats and toasted away.  Amazing s'mores btw!  We took pics with Santa and ate the very best smoked turkey leg!  We had a great time and the kids and our little furbabies really enjoyed it.  Thanks Bama Slam!

name: Steve McIver
text: Had a blast.  Very nice, well run off-road park.  Lots to do and facilities were awesome.

name: Matt Johnston
text: Very fun place to go ride Atvs and Side by sides. They always have fun events on the weekend and q saloon at night that is alot of fun with live music. Highly recommend.

text: Best mud park/trails closest to enterprise Dothan area

name: Becky Potts-Seal
text:
Lots of fun great trails for the whole family to ride and enjoy.
A few mud holes
Staff is nice, Most of the people we encountered are nice and helpful.
You don't have to have a big jacked up off road vehicle to ride here unless you plan on muddin in the deeper water holes.

name: Rachel Teague
text: Great haunted trail - we had a blast ..well worth $5 admission -

name: Meri Mock
text: We cane to the Swimming Hole and were very impressed with everything. The ATV area was nice, the Saloon was great and of course the Swimming Hole was refreshing. Everything seems so well thought out and well planned. Very impressed.

text: Very nice and kid friendly. Will be going back.

resp.text: Thank you!! We look forward to you joining us again!

text: Nice place

text: Trails everyone can have fun on! Big place, brand new, still working on the organization but overall pretty good.  Swimming Hole area is great.

name: samuel graham

name: Buddy Josey
text: We had a great time, can't wait to come back again! The staff was friendly and helpful, the park was clean and signs posted on all trails. My family will be spending a lot of time there all year long.

resp.text:
Keturah,

What kind words! Thank you so much! We are so glad you had such a great experience with us!

text: Nice venue, clean, well maintained and secluded but close to restaurants and hotels.

resp.text: Thank you so much, Deb! We sincerely appreciate your feedback!

name: Armando Martinez
text: Awesome people and place to host your wedding. Very reasonably priced. Grooms cabin is perfect to relax with the guys before the big day and a very short drive to the venue. Barn house is beautiful and spacious. Both Jessica and Lauren are awesome people that will go above and beyond to make sure every detail is just the way you want it. I would recommend this place to anyone looking to have a beautiful and stress free wedding

resp.text: Thank you so much Armando! We appreciate your review and LOVED helping you guys have the Best Day Ever at The Barn!

name: LeeAnn Carter
text: The wedding was beautiful. So much fun there.

name: Debbie Borders
text: Absolutely beautiful! Awesome place to have a wedding! 💗

name: Sherry Kerr
text: My son and daughter-in-law were recently married here, and I can't say enough about the beautiful venue, impeccable service, and attention to detail. Madelin and her team made everything easy for us in preparing for the day, anticipating our needs and fulfilling our every request. The design of the barn lends itself easily to many different types of layouts and events. The big bonus: the house at The Barn, which is both beautiful and functional in providing the wedding party a place to get ready and assemble, and the newlyweds a gorgeous honeymoon suite. You won't find a venue for your event that will be more beautiful or accommodating.

Best,
The Barn at Bennett Flats

name: Brian Kitchens
text: My fiance and I were so excited to be getting married here. Our wedding was scheduled for March 28th. Unfortunately, the state mandated no gatherings of 25 or more people and we needed to reschedule. We were offered a couple of other dates that did not work with the schedules of everyone else. Southern Charm advised us that "maybe we shouldn't be so picky." It was evident we needed to change venues. Southern Charm would not return our deposit of $500 over something that was no fault of our own. It is not as if our cancellation prevented them from renting the facility to another. I'm extremely disappointed to see this behavior during times like this.

resp.text: We sincerely regret that you were disappointed with our efforts to please you and your fiancé. We fully recognized the extenuating circumstances caused by the current corona virus mandates and have worked with each of our clients to shift dates and assist with rescheduling for happier days ahead. It was because we knew the circumstances were beyond your control, just as they were beyond ours, that we DID choose to extend a refund of your $2000 rental fee, despite it being contractually non-refundable with your cancellation being so close to your reservation date. We felt it was a kind response and the right thing to do. We further offered to allow you to apply the $500 non-refundable deposit toward ANY “OPEN” DATE in the future. That offer remained extended. We are incredibly sorry if someone made the remark you mentioned and can only imagine it would ever be said as a poor attempt at humor under stress. Our employees are wonderful people, but there is certainly nothing funny about the times in which we find our world right now. That being said, we still hold hope for a brighter tomorrow for everyone, and we continue to welcome you to find an alternative open date to book Southern Charm for your needs.

name: Savannah Blake
text: Beautiful and elegant! We loved it! Pictures turned out great and it was just wonderful! The only complaint is that it was hot. The walls had gaps in the wood which I'm sure added to the aesthetic but it was very warm even with the air full blast

resp.text: Thank you, Savannah! We are delighted you were pleased. We do apologize for the temperature issue you experienced. As you noted, the barn style is part of our aesthetic, and we are one of the few barn venues who have heat and air. Even so, we appreciate your feedback, along with others, as we do have plans to insulate and add more wood to the walls to help with temperature for the comfort of future guests. We appreciate your review and hope you’ll share our venue with your friends!

resp.text: Thank you, Adrienne. We are delighted you were pleased with our venue.

text: Camp Meadowbrook is a beautiful wedding venue! Johnny is just amazing. He was very kind and very easy to work with. Book this venue.You will not regret it!

text: Was there (as tech adv.) with my daughter laying out plans for her up coming event. Very nice facility. Johnny the care taker was very understanding and helpful.

text: Very pretty place with wonderful views

name: Mandy Nall
text: I've been a loyal patron of Country's BBQ since they opened their door for business on Zelda Road. It's truly the BEST BBQ locally.  Everything on the menu is homemade.  They offer everything from the best variety picks of vegetables (sweet potato is the bomb and HUGE, fried okra, corn on the cob, great fried green tomatoes are so yummy, field peas, mashed potatoes, cabbage… all recommended). The Q stew, i.e.:Brunswick stew is a winner. ALL PORK AND BEEF platters, inside or outside chopped, served with 1 or 2 sides,  French bread or cornbread will fill you up with a to-go box for sure. The ribs fall off the bone,  and I truly recommend the chef salad.  All dressings are homemade. Price per person is about $10-14 for a full meal. Homemade lemonade and sweet tea are outstanding. Don't forget dessert.  The pecan pie and lemon pie are the best around. If you've got the time to wait, their steaks are excellent too. Chopped steak is my favorite, the fried chicken fingers are so crisp and tender. My kids love them. They cater too, and do a very good job. Try a nearby Country's,  you won't be disappointed,  I promise.

name: Jeremy English
text: Had the special, pulled pork plate. It was honestly great, sauce was pleasing and not too sweet. The sweet tea was outstanding, service was good, it wasn't crowded at all when I went. A little pricey at $13+, though.

name: Linda H
text: I am very impressed with the owner of this establishment. If for some reason you have any problem, he will immediately take care of it for you. I suppose any of us can have a less than favorable experience, anywhere, at any time. I know first hand that Mr. Powell appears to care that his customers have a favorable experience!

resp.text: Dear Linda H, I greatly apologize for your experience this weekend with Country's Barbecue. That is not how I want our customers to be dining on a holiday! Please call me at the corporate office so I can make it up to you. Sincerely, Mark Powell 271-2017

name: Cynthia P
text: Can't wrong with Country's BBQ.  I've never ordered anything I didn't enjoy.  They have a great club Sammy, a great (big) salad, great chopped pork, delicious sides and so much more!!  If you don't give them a try, you will be missing out on a great meal.

name: UnicornPoo OnU
text: This is the second time me and my girlfriend have eaten here. The first time it was ok but nothing to write home about and tonight made the first time seem like a great experience. She got the pulled pork sandwich and fries. The pork was tough and cold and the fries were cold and covered in grease. I got the Larry's Special which is supposed to be tenderloin marinated in special sauce, and fries. The meat came out just slightly warm and the fries were cold and covered in grease. When they refer to their special sauce, what the menu should say is that the meat has been swimming in Dale's Sauce for about a week and is almost too salty to eat. The waiter asked how the food was, which was obviously a formality because when I told him he acted as if I'd said the food was great and walked away. That's the last $30 this place will ever get out of me.

resp.text: Hi Jonathan, I am sorry you were less than happy with your recent experience at our Zelda Rd. location. Everyone can have a bad day and maybe you caught us on one of ours. Please call me at the corporate office (271-2017) so I can make it up to you. I hope you'll give us another try. Sincerely, Mark Powell - Owner

name: Brian Wilson
text: Loved our experience at Country's BBQ on Zelda Road in Montgomery!  Highly recommend to anyone for some of the best BBQ in the River Region.  Wife and I thoroughly enjoyed the food and the sauces were to DIE FOR!

name: K&A GrassBusters
text: Ordered to go at Zelda Rd. I give a 2 star only because the stew and the tea was good.  My fiance order was messed up she ordered Okra and got fries cold fries at that also we didn't get the bread with our order. We changed from the Atlanta Hwy location to Zelda Rd because ATL Hwy messed our order up big time with my whole family it took us months to eat at Country's again probably will just cook my own from now on seeing the one place that had it together when I was growing surely doesn't have it any more

name: Jessie Godfrey
text: The food was fantastic and the service was spot on! Had the chef salad with homemade ranch with pulled pork with bacon! Yes, it was as amazing as it sounds!

name: Kaleigh Flatt
text: Great place for lunch.  I always get the vegetable plate or the brunswick stew.  And of course a giant sweet tea!

name: Tech Man
text: 2 or 3 times a year I drive from Atlanta to Mobile and back, this is my halfway point. I do not miss stopping in for lunch in both directions! Always great food and smiles!

name: Jacob Sterrett
text: Absolutely delicious, we had the barbeque platters with two of the sides from the infinite selection. Meat was great, they had wonderful sauces as well. Would reccomend 5/5!

name: Pamala Howell-Paoli
text: We were travelling through and looked on our phone to see what BBQ places were here. To my enthusiasm n surprise, Country's BBQ. I grew up in Columbus, Ga and go back from time to time. And EVERY TIME I do go back 1st place I stop is Country's. I LOVE Columbus Country BBQ and longed for it. About 3pm when we first walked in, the Mgr told us "to walk over there, grab a menu and seat where ever we wanted". There was 2 other couples in dining area. The waitress was outstanding!! I don't remember her name, but she was super bubblely. But we were so disappointed with the food. I ordered my usual; pulled pork platter. Husband ordered his usual; 1/2 chicken. Well the pork was drowned in chutney n coleslaw juices, which totally ruined the taste mainly b/c I don't like chutney. I used a numerous amount of napkins to dry up the juice. Husband's chicken looked liked it was cooked the day before or real early that morning. The BBQ sauce was dried and skin was wrinkled up and some spots were burnt. It was very dry. Husband informed waitress and she was very helpful and offered another one, fresher or something else. He ordered another chicken. The 2nd chicken was a more moist but didn't compare to the taste of Country's in Columbus. If Jim is affiliated with this establishment, he would be ashamed. Also, the Mgr had fixed a plate for herself and sat and ate. Not once did she come over to ask about why we sent it back.  How convenient it would've been since we travel through Montgomery often and it's closer than Columbus for us. Needless to say, we won't be coming back or if by some chance we do, we will hope to remember and not order the same thing.......

resp.text:
Dear Pamala,

I am so sorry to hear about your recent experience at our Zelda Road location. I am glad your waitress was wonderful, but I am disappointed to hear about your food experience. Thank you for bringing these issues to my attention so I can address them immediately. I would like to make it up to you! Please give me a call at the corporate office... 334-271-2017

Sincerely,
Mark Powell, Owner

name: Jim Davis
text: My wife and I have been stopping at Country's for over 25 years when traveling between Atlanta and Pensacola FL. The BBQ is excellent, sweet potatoes are hugh, the backfire slaw is tangy, and the fried green tomatoes are outstanding. We love this restaurant.

name: MARJORIE BAKER
text: Excellent, excellent barbecue, great brunswick stew, top notch chef salad and good southern sweet tea.  Would just ask them to work on appearance of restaurant, particularly the drive thru area.  Needs a bit of cleaning at the window, outside and inside.

name: Robert Smith
text: This was the first time we have eaten at (take out) Country's BBQ (night of 23 Feb 2015).  I am not sure if the staff was just busy at time of order or what.  While calling in the order the person taking the order seemed inpatient. We picked up the order 10 minutes later and noticed there was only one person dining in Country's BBQ, 4 staff in the kitchen and one or two staff in the dining area. About 4 orders were picked up while we waited 10 more minutes (added item to order) for our order. After getting home I realized my 1/2 and 1/2 order of fried pickles and onions was far from being fried.  In fact it was very clear they had gone straight from the container to my take out container. Not cooked what-so-ever. I was soo disappointed. Was really looking forward to trying the side dishes. Now I travel a lot and have been to great BBQ places across the US and outside the US and this is definetly not one of them. Anyone who says Country's BBQ is great has not had good BBQ. Aside from the poorly prepared side dishes the BBQ (chicken and beef) was just okay, definetly not worth mentioning. Being that the food was just okay at best there was no reason to call and complain as we would have only gotten more phone attitude.  Would not recommend this place.

resp.text:
Dear Robert,
Please allow us to apologize. We get a lot of good comments about our marinated barbecue onions. We have garnished our plates with these for 33 years. We only started frying these a short while ago. I have found the ticket for that evening and it is obvious that we filled the order with or regular marinated onions not fried… The order the chef got reflected barbecue onions and pickles, not fried or half-n-half. A simple miscommunication.  Please feel free to call the corporate office anytime you are not satisfied. 334-271-2017. I would be glad to forward you a replacement coupon or a refund. Thank you for taking the time to advise us.  Your business is sincerely appreciated.
Sincerely,
Mark Powell, Owner

Also love the ducks they have there.

text: I love this place! It just keeps getting better and better! The owner (Ken) is a great guy! The staff there is awesome!

Follow me on Instagram: a.leestudios

Best track I've been.

Ken is the man.

name: Jay Reed (JargonJC)
text:
A wonderful experience for any Motorhead. The track has several tight turns that will test your car and it does not matter what kind of car you have. I have a Volvo wagon and I kept up with my friend and their Miata.

Every third Sunday of the month is when they have open track days and the cost is $75 for all day access. The owner even cooked us lunch on a grill.

name: cody king
text: Went as just a spectator, pulled my buddies car for him had a blast spite the heat. 10/10 recommend.

name: Elsea’s World
text: I am proud to call Midpond my home track. Ken works extremely hard to keep the landscape perfect and it shows. Track is nice and tight, makes for great drifting!

name: Jeremy Lester
text: Hands down the most inviting atmosphere of any track. Owner in incredibly nice and accommodating. Always making improvements and conscious of making the track safe for drivers and cars. Will definitely be making a trip back down in the future the whole way from PA!

name: David Shaddix
text: Raw, Ridiculous,  Ripping Fun!

name: Edward Lee
text: Awesome race track. Ken, the owner, is awesome. He let us camp anywhere on his racetrack and even let us use his fire pit to cook and keep warm. I'll be back soon for more drift events. Thanks Ken!

name: James Drumheller
text: Love this place

name: Christopher Lovett
text: Awesome place great people awesome staff.

name: Josh Halterman
text: Absolutely fantastic. Great track, tons of seat time, and tons of fun. Ken, the owner, is an awesome guy. Definitely coming back!

text: Wonderful venue!  I highly recommend  J & D Farms for your wedding venue.   Friendly and accommodating owners and staff.  Beautiful barns, carriage house and grounds.

name: Sharon Iwasa Perkins
text: Just had my granddaughter’s wedding here. She’s a fan of the Keira Knightly Pride and Prejudice movie, and when I saw the chandeliers in the barn (see photo), I saw why she chose this venue. It was perfect. We had approximately 125 guests in attendance, and we fit well in both the ceremony and reception areas. While the weather was sunny and hot, they cranked up the AC in the barn. Also, my granddaughter had fans printed up and passed out, so people were fanning themselves throughout the service in true Southern style. After the ceremony, we walked across the gravel road to the reception area, and dined under the wide open blue skies. Fireflies danced among the rose bushes as evening softly surrounded us, and the stars and twinkle lights added to our celebration. Of course, my granddaughter’s father-daughter dance music selection was the opening theme song of the movie, “Pride and Prejudice.” Then, the DJ put on the latest dance music, and the crowd of twenty-somethings danced the night away. The food and bar offerings were greedily devoured. I found the J and D staff kept our needs met unobtrusively but also with a sweet spirit. We just loved everything about this wedding, and it location was a large factor in our celebration. We’re very grateful.

name: Nadal Kim
text: Incredible venue with very accommodating staff members. Definitely would love to come visit again.

text: Beautiful setting for a wedding !

text: I was in love with this venue from the first time I saw it online. When we did our first visit, I quickly realized that this was the only choice for our wedding. The owners are very helpful, and accommodating. They are obviously invested in making each wedding perfect. They are quick to field questions, and flexible on the use of the space. I would very highly recommend using this venue to anyone! Thanks for making our big day so perfect!

name: Victor S.
text: Just had our daughter’s wedding here! Love the venue as well as all the staff! Danny does exactly what he tells you he will do! Mackenzie was a sweetheart! We have 3 other children & I would be perfectly satisfied to do this place again! Also, can’t say enough good about the vendors that came recommended! Thanks again for a beautiful, memorable day!

name: John Tipler
text: Recently attended a wedding here. The grounds are fantastic. Rustic, sophisticated, well-maintained, and classy. The small goat enclosure was a pleasant surprise. The reception area was big and had some great views.

name: Eric Chase Stewart
text: Beautiful venue. Love how it sits right in the mountain

name: Sherry Wisener
text: Beautiful, warm and inviting!!

name: John Traylor
text:
Went to J & D Farms to attend the wedding of some friends. It was very hot, though I obviously don't knock the location for that. My main complaint would be that they had to move the chairs from the ceremony area to the reception area. This took about 20 minutes, and left all the guests standing confused in heat. No one came to tell us when they were finished setting up, and we eventually meandered up to the barn where the reception was held. There were also quite a few chiggers (red bugs), at the barn as well. Perhaps this all wasn't to their fault and was resultant of poor planning, though it seemed as though it was.

The parking was also odd, it was about a quarter of a mile from the venue. They had transportation between places in the form of what was basically a golf cart. Though they took forever to come back and forth, resulting in my girlfriend walking up the hill in heels.

Overall the place was quite beautiful, I hate to give this sort of review to such a lovely place, but this was my experience.

resp.text:
Hi John,
Thanks so much for your review and the kind words about the overall beauty of our venue. In regards to the seating in the orchard... we actually have multiple seating options available that do not require seating to be moved from ceremony to the reception. We have over 300 chairs, vintage church pews as well as custom made wood benches. In this case it was requested that the same chairs be utilized at both, ceremony and reception, so we did in fact have to move them... which is a job that  requires about 20 minutes and 6 staff members. We do strongly discourage this option, but ultimately it’s the decision of the bride. :-) As far as instructing guest to make their way to the barn, this would fall under the job of a wedding planner or coordinator, not the venue itself. In regards to chiggars, we do keep all gathering areas around the barn and reception area mowed and well maintained, however we do have 40 acres of Bermuda surrounding the barn, so if you got in any of these areas, a chigger or two is very likely :-). Finally, our parking lot is located on site but 600 feet from the barn. We do this as an effort to keep the ceremony & reception area safe, as well as clear of vehicles for photography purposes. A 6 seater electric (2017 Polaris Gem) shuttle is available for all weddings. The round trip for this takes only 90 seconds, of course that time does vary..  Especially when exiting, as we make every effort to drop guest directly at their car.  Again thank you for the very kind words. We hope you get the opportunity to attend another wedding soon!

text: Everything about our experience was amazing. We had our wedding here on April 10th and it was everything I ever wanted. Cody, Elizabeth, and the whole Oak Island Team were amazing! It is truly a venue only so you're able to choose all your own vendors rather than having to use the provided vendors as it is with some venues. We had our rehearsal dinner at the mansion Friday night and the entire wedding party was able to stay both Friday and Saturday which made thing so easy! I would absolutely, 100% recommend this venue for any wedding or event!

Elizabeth is the main owner I dealt with and while she was nice on the initial tour she would not respond to any texts or calls after we paid our deposit and we had to end up getting on touch with some of the other owners who were very nice. She was very rude on the wedding day. After the wedding, the caterer was boxing up food and Elizabeth (the owner) asked for a plate and after our caterer told her she would have to ask my mom because we paid for all the food she proceeded to just help herself to our leftover food. If you’re a bride and want a helpful venue owner who is responsive and not have to worry about everything being good then this is not the place for you. They still owe me money.

name: Megan Hoehn
text:
ABSOLUTELY PERFECT WEDDING DAY!!
When looking for a venue in a town we were unfamiliar with, finding Yolanda and her staff was a god-send. We wanted to avoid the "wedding nightmares" you hear about with vendors falling through or ripping you off or all of the above and we chose wisely. We visited the venue and after meeting Yolanda, we immediately said “this is the one”. We looked no further and this is the only venue we visited. It is as beautiful in person as you see in the many photos on their website and in other bride's pictures. I cannot wait to get our pictures/videos back. It is a family owned business and quite reasonable in the grand scheme of average wedding costs. We had unlimited contact and visits with all staff. We moved to the south a year before getting engaged and decided to have everyone come down to us for a good ol’ southern wedding. The logistics were overwhelming and Yolanda, Candace and Terri were wonderful in making sure everyone was picked up, transported and generally accommodated. They take care of all the major details so for a detail-oriented person like me, it was great because I had time to craft my own little personal touches. We rented out the mansion for the immediate families and wedding party to spend the night with their guests and when we pulled up, we got nothing less than Ooos and Ahhs about how beautiful and serene it all is. Every vendor Yolanda has in her arsenal is remarkable and a joy to work with - she wouldn't have it any other way and that is how you know you're looking at the right venue/planner. The day-of coordinator (Terri) is a MUST-DO for Brides. We actually ate at our wedding! We had our first meal as husband and wife and no one even knew and just assumed the wedding norm ( that you don’t get to eat the delicious food you hand-selected!) It was absolutely incredible. Everyone was so surprised that she answered all of their questions, let them do whatever they wanted within reason and even partied and had a blast with us. You will not find a more flexible venue/planner anywhere. There were bridesmaid's guests that were not a part of the wedding party and while we were off taking pictures or getting ready, she let them hang out, swim in the pool and generally do whatever as if they were at their own homes. In terms of the wedding, she was willing to go above and beyond to make the day special for us. She found us the perfect officiant who let us do a cultural element as part of our ceremony – something they were equally as excited to see executed. We wanted to light off lanterns at the end of the night and she said absolutely. Nothing was out of the realm of possibilities or "against the rules" and that is how your wedding day should be - exactly as you want. Everywhere else we looked there was a “No-no” list of things you cannot do – be out by 11, no open flames, no loud music, etc etc. That list does not exist at Oak Island and they will try to accommodate all of your requests within reason.

If you are looking for a one of a kind wedding experience with seasoned professionals, listen to their advice (they've done way more weddings than you!) and go with Oak Island Weddings. We could not have been happier with our choice.

name: Sara Mosier
text:
I've been here twice with my roommates, both times for their children's birthday parties.

The first time was around Aug 2020, and it was pretty dead in the bowling alley.  We were the only customers in there for at least the first hour.  We purchased the 2 hour package, which you get to choose your food from a list, you get several arcade play cards with tokens and a laminated bowling pin for the birthday child.   Any food you don't finish, they allow you to box up and take with you!

Surprisingly,  the food is actually really good.  We had chicken tenders, pizza, and mac n cheese balls the first time, and cheesy bread, chicken tenders and buffalo cauliflower this last time.

The second time we went, which was this month, they were a LOT busier but the experience was still pretty amazing.  Bottom line, both children loved their birthday parties and we would do this for either of them again!

resp.text: Sara thank you for the five-star review about our Bowlero! Looks like you had a great time on the lanes and we appreciate the feedback. Hope you’ll come back to bowl with us again soon!

name: Shirley Justice

text: I've he never heard newly (not sure the date) renovated.  48 well manicured lanes.  2 full service bars at each of the alley.  Full arcade for family and childrens/kids fun.  Conveniently located right off the interstate and in a quiet area of Columbus.

name: Kelly Kennedy
text: Ladies state tournemt, fun place.  let was nice, clean and staff was so polite?  Overall a great place!!

resp.text: Kelly thank you for the five-star review about our Bowlero! Looks like you had a great time on the lanes and we appreciate the feedback. Hope you’ll come back to bowl with us again soon!

text: This is our 3rd year having our school staff party here.  We really enjoy it! The staff went all out decreasing for us! Only complaint is the wait to get nachos refilled.  But they were amazing!! Awesome fun time! Laser tag had great memories and many laughs.

text: When Stars and Strikes didn't  have any lanes open we went here and they had some open. Had a great time.

resp.text: Chrisrian five stars right back at ya! Thanks for taking the time to leave us a review. We’re grateful for your business and that you chose to spend your time on the lanes with us. Come bowling again with us soon 🎳🎳

name: Carol Brown
text: Took my girls to the Pepsi Bowling Tournament today at Bowlero in Columbus, GA. Food prices are pretty high, but the facility was clean and employees were nice.

resp.text: Carol we appreciate you showing us some love! Thank you for bowling with us and we look forward to having you back on the lanes soon!

name: Billy Griswold
text: Some things have changed since i was a kid but some are the same. They upgraded just enough to make it better. But had enough same to bring back childhood memories.

resp.text: Billy thanks for sharing your positive experience bowling with us. We’re so glad you had a great time and look forward to seeing you back on the lanes soon!

name: Gary Bunkley
text: The atmosphere was awesome had a great time bowling with my cuzn a much needed night out. My only concern is the high prices for a Friday night but will definitely keep on coming back for more fun..

resp.text: Gary thank you for the five-star review! Looks like you had a great time on the lanes and we appreciate the feedback. Hope you’ll come back to bowl with us again soon!

name: carissa AP (Capxox)
text: We celebrated a birthday and paid for a party which came with bowling, arcade games and lunch, a cookie cake as well as pizza, chicken fingers and tater tots. Had a good time even during covid.

name: Rosemary Mayo
text: I was impressed at how they are handling life during the pandemic.   Lots of distance.   Clean and safe surroundings and materials.   A good  place for some family fun especially for children to get out and enjoy some much needed fun and exercise!!

name: Heather Haskell
text: While they were happy to accommodate our special Olympian bowler on this visit who has been vaccinated,  the mask requirement was not being enforced for others.

resp.text: Heather the health and safety of our guests and staff members is our top priority and we thank you for reaching out. At Bowlero, we are following local and state protocols regarding usage of masks and PPE and have passed your comments along to management. Please reach us at guestservice@bowlerocorp.com if you’d like to discuss further.

name: Rosalea Cody Williams
text: Be prepared to have a tab on your lane .... it will add up quickly

resp.text: Rosalea thanks for leaving us a 4 star review! We’re so grateful you chose to bowl with us and we hope you’ll come back and visit us in the near future!

name: Darrin Jones
text: Great place for bowling,  but when you're running a tournament need to have more employees working snack bar over 1hr for food in unacceptable

resp.text: Darrin we’re sorry you experienced a long wait time. We’re constantly looking for ways to improve our efficiency and your feedback is very much appreciated.  We have sent this along to our operations team and we thank you for taking the time to reach out to us. We hope to see you again soon!

text: First trying this place. And the customer service is unbelieveable (in a wonderful). The bar tender was such a delight. We'll be back this weekend

text: The facility was fairly clean.  They were prepared for the covid-19 required social distancing. The bar was closed.  The kitchen and snack bar was restricted to staff only. Enjoy your evening but expect to pay 9 dollars a game on Friday night.

2) it doesn't seem like there's enough people working in the back for ball returns and Pen setup.

name: William Propst
text: Great atmosphere. Place stays packed on the weekends and they do events all the time. Bar and food service is seriously slow, though. Usually takes around 20-25 minutes to get a drink or some food. The bar gets backed up really easily on weekend nights so there ends up being a huge line. Still a great place to come bowl

name: Raina Brown
text: My friend and I went there on Christmas  night  to play  pool. We had fun!!! I love the updates  that you all have done. The only things I wish you could change is more pool tables in the bar area not just that lonely one  that's on the floor. And making sure that the servers  sees when there is people  playing  pool that's  by the laser  tag.

name: Sabrina Kassam
text: Jarred was awesome at having the party run smoothly and enjoyable. The staff ensured we had enough napkins & drink refills & gave us the plates for the cake. I celebrated my daughter's 10th birthday here. They let her do two song requests. They had the bumpers up etc. They even added our guest's names for us in the system as they all arrived. We had our own private area. The pizza was filling & delicious. They had set up Happy Birthday with my daughter's name. I have zero complaints. 100% fully satisfied customer. Booking was easy. The staff answered all questions & accommodated our needs perfectly to our desires. I look forward to coming again. Each child in the party also had a $3 complimentary arcade card which was very much enjoyed after bowling. We are very grateful for our positive experience. Honestly, my expectations were exceeded. Way to go Bowlero. Thank you!  I would definitely recommend this bowling alley for any age or event.

text: Fun but needs better seletion of music

text: Terrible service. The lane broke after almost every frame. 4 dollars for a soda? No blue moon beer on a Saturday night at 9 ? Don’t waste your money here.

name: Christopher Oswald
text: The tables are lousy and interrupt your ability to move around. Not much free space if you have a few people and the stand with the keyboard blocks access to the balls and blower. The shoes have a big lip around the edge of them and it is the most expensive bowling alley I've ever been to. The decor is nice and the place looks very well taken care of.

name: Nikki Sheffield
text: Nice family atmosphere

resp.text: Nikki we love hearing this about our Columbus team! Thanks for bowling with us and we look forward to the next time you join us on the lanes 🎳

text: My first time, had a good time, food and drinks was excellent.

name: Tarren Bruce
text: It was a little pricey but I enjoyed my vist.

name: Brittany Kendall
text: We had a small get-together today at the bowling alley for my daughter's birthday, we didn't do any of the packages they have for birthdays because we already had a party the night before- we just simply brought a few of her friends and went bowling. I ordered a few kids meals and drinks and we had an amazing time, that was all because of the guy that runs the front named Nick. Nick did an amazing job helping me get the kids shoes and lane ready and he went above and beyond to help me with refills on drinks and getting their food out. He made our experience there amazing, we will definitely be returning in the near future and will be telling all of our friends about are outstanding experience. Thanks again Nick, you helped make my daughter's birthday party amazing

name: Quilla Brown
text: Fun,fast service nice staff

name: Chris Benton
text: A nice bowling alley but, they charge a little more than $7 per person per game. It's not just a charge for the lane and the show rental. Was not clarified beforehand when we asked. It cost my wife and I $50+ for 3 games not including the price of our drinks. I even had my own ball and shoes. Won't be coming back.

name: Karen
text: This was a great time with my youngest boy for family day. The staff was helpful, knew what they were doing and the place was clean.

name: Tonya Ford Dale
text: Bowlero was great! Sunday evening is my time to come! The place was will let, service was fantastic, and food was delicious. I still can't bowl worth a flip, but I had a good time! 💜

name: XzoticPinky
text: Fun place to take ur family.

name: Simon Strothers
text: A little on the expense side for a lane that had trouble picking the pins up.

name: Kathy Perez
text: First, I came here with my family because of the good reviews. However, it was very disappointing. We waited in line to check in over 15 min and it was not busy at all. Maybe 3 lanes in use. Second, we tried ordering pizza and wings and drinks, over $100 so we passed'. 4 drinks were $18. The arcade is a joke. $5 only gives for one game. Service was awful. Overall, if more looking to spend $200 bowling, this place is for you included with bad service. Never again.

name: Vicky Hatchett
text: I had a blast our church family went for a night of bowling and I tell you we had a really great time  they gave us a great group discount we had booked in advance the even had our section decorated I thought that was so nice this is a great place to go and just have great fun 5 stars ratings

name: Erika Schmidt
text:
I am a recreational bowler who bowls a good amount and there is nothing worse than mistreated lanes, this Bowlero has good lanes. They are well greased. Really my only issue is most of the finger-holes on the bowling balls are chipped. It has a great layout and is kept very neat and tidy.

They also give a great military discount, which I appreciated it!

name: Teresa Berg
text: Good place to have a kids party but food limited and overpriced.

name: Karin B
text: This was an awful experience. It took the cashier 20 minutes to ring up the person in front of me. We finally get to order our lanes, and she said they have socks. So, I buy a pair to find out there are no socks. Then, she can't refund me while I am up there because she needs her manager that will not come up there. Next, we cannot start the game because the bumpers are not electronic. I was able to run to Target and back before they got the bumpers up. Of course, everyone has to use bumpers, which is lame. Do not come here. What a waste.

name: Melena Hendley
text: A bit expensive. Hopefully they will become fully functional soon.

name: Pamela
text: Very comfortable atmosphere. I came for a work get together. I always enjoy this place.

text: Its over priced but really fun

text: We came in to only get one lane.  We were told 39 minute wait to clean a lane & possibly longer? I am a league bowler at different lanes.  This is ridiculous! There were at least 10 lanes open at this time! Poor lane management and customer service.. will go somewhere else the next time we want to bowl!

name: AngelA Sellars
text: Love stuff!!

resp.text: AngelA we love hearing this about our Columbus team! Thanks for bowling with us and we look forward to the next time you join us on the lanes 🎳

text: Fun place to visit. Prices are fair. Drinks are cheap. Equipment doesn't always work as it is supposed to.

name: brittany wesolko
text: It was really nice and big. They are really friendly and when we were on our last bowl our time was almost up and Jered extended our time a little so we could finish. I would definitely come back and bowl here again.

name: Quincy. MOV
text:
The waitress at the bar was really rude... it was like an hour wait for the food and and 2 hour wait just to bowl.. you would be better of going to stars and strikes.

P.S it was dirty also.

name: Charles Butler
text: Absolutely terrible customer service. Due to a family emergency we had to cancel our reservations for a bowling party. They wouldn't even consider giving us a refund they just kept our money and offered us a useless credit. The staff then contacted us the next day after we had cancelled demanding to know where we were. They were incredibly rude and unprofessional. We had to ask several times who we were talking g to and they just kept demanding to speak with my wife by name. I can safely say I will not be using this company again and I advise other to stay away and book your party with a different company.

name: Miriam Ortiz
text: Love the people the place it's fun.

name: shari baldwin
text: Great Atmosphere, it's a little pricey to bowl on a saturday after 7pm. If you go before 7pm the price to bowl is not bad. Even though it was crowded, we was able to get a lane.

name: Cocchiara Bell
text: It was unsafe. The sign outside said that masks were required, however nobody else besides me, my son and daughter in law were wearing them. If there is a sign stating required then it should be enforced to wear masks.

name: Jessica Nichols
text: Jared and Cameron were awesome! The customer service they provided was the best that I’ve received in a long time. It was definitely a diamond quality experience.

name: Rana Darvesh
text: Nice place to go with your family and they have good discounts almost daily. The manager and staff were really friendly and honest. Forget my CC and DL and they kept then safe until I came back for them! Thanks!

name: Meshea Payne
text: Me and my friends went on a Saturday and they did not have any like group deals matter fact they didn't have any deals at all so everyone had to pay individually I didn't think that was cool at all I think you should always have some type of little group coupons or or something like that no I would not recommend this place to anyone

Then I overheard the other attendant tell another group it's $7/game. I will not be back to this location I did not feel welcomed. text: Nice place. The food was good! A little pricey for everything but we had fun! The bathrooms were clean and they had a lot to do beside bowl. Very nice facility!

text: Had a great time with friends and the facility was great, but the service was lacking. Our waitress was super nice and helpful, but there wasn't enough help for a Saturday night. She did all she could, just needed additional staff support. 30 minutes for a drink is TOO long to wait.

text: We went here with family after the holidays and were pleasantly surprised. The new updates are beautiful and inviting. I love the flooring. The bartender was very sweet, too. It's got a good mix of classics like ski ball and air hockey with newer electronic games like flappy bird and candy crush.

text:

text: It was freezing cold in there. As I appreciate it not being 75°+ where my ball sticks to my hand, below 60° where I cant even hold on to my ball is not cool.

text: Wow - bowling is just the beginning.  Laser tag, beat arcade, pool tables, air hockey, and foosball.  Serve excellent drinks at reasonable prices with terrific specials at certain days and times - usually after 8pm.   The staff was wonderfully accommodating, responsive, and friendly.

name: Jason Harris
text: Amazing employees! The check in counter people seemed happy to get us on a lane and our server name was Hailey. She was very polite and respectful and got our orders as soon as possible and got it to us quickly. They did seem a little under staffed with the servers with there being a party going on and a good bit of lanes takin and only her there. Its a very clean facility and they have easy to find balls. The food is a bit expensive but well worth it.

name: Timothy Buckner
text: I enjoy the time I've recently spent with good company here at Bowlero. Had issues with a few of the lanes but the staff took care of those issues promptly after being notified.

text: Lanes are good but they are way understaff, you have to wait a long time for a drink and food. The bartender many times is not at the bar so you have to wait for her to come to the bar ( I dont know where she hides). The waitress is really nice but is just one girl most of the times.

text: The bowling was good but waited an hour for some nachos. Didnt even get any compensation or anything for the inconvenience of waiting an hour for nachos. Will not recommend this place

text: It"s a nice place but, last week I paid 23.49 for three people to bowl 3 games and rented a pair of shoes. This week we went and was told the exact same games and people would cost me 60.52. I asked why the difference and was told, the prices had been raised, really? Can't afford to go there again.

text: My girls and I had a great time

name: Derek
text: This place is 10 times better now after they remodeled it. Very nice and tons of room now, the arcade was enjoyed by the kids and we all had a blast at laser tag. However, for a family of four it gets ridiculously expensive to bowl, get snacks or almost anything else. About the only time we go now is when Groupon has sales. If it was more affordable it would have been 5 stars.

name: Emily Heim
text: Great bowling center. The food and drinks are high priced so be prepared. The bathrooms are clean. The arcade is really good. Definitely enjoy coming every year for Pepsi Qualifying.

name: Christina Stanbro
text: DO NOT ORDER THE BUFFALO WINGS. They come straight from the fiery pits of hell and will only haunt you while you bowl. Had fun

name: Dan Taylor
text:
My wife and I went along with another couple for a couple of games of late night bowling on a Saturday night.

I have bowled for many years and I've been to many different bowling alleys.

I was impressed with the size and amount of lanes this location had and definitely the house ball selection for those who don't have their own ball. We hadn't planned on visiting the bowling alley while we were in town so I used a house ball this particular evening. The balls are arranged by weight and not just thrown in random spots.

There are large screens with graphics for each lane to keep you entertained.  The location has a bar, arcade, and pool table. The staff was friendly. We'll be going back soon.

name: Mel R.
text: Nice. Clean. Game area was cool. Wait time was a bit much, especially since there were over 10 lanes unoccupied. Supposed tournament, but there wasn't any tournament happening. 😕

name: Chris Nesbit
text: Very good lanes. Service was great.

name: ronald massey
text: My wife and I, our daughter and our grandson, 5 years old, spent the evening. And had a great time. It is family oriented people will very helpful and got to talk with others and meet others.

name: Cody Tillery
text:
We went on a Sunday afternoon around 2pm. We ordered a hotdog,hamburger, and a shrimp popper meal which took a whole hour to get to us.
It seems like there were only 4 people working with many of the lanes full. I don't know if people called out but management should have found fill ins instead of running their employees ragged.
We had a much better experience coming here on a Saturday night than a less busy Sunday afternoon.

name: CARLOS ANDERSON
text: Customer service is lacking here. The lane I was on kept having issues and it took forever for the STAFF to respond and address the matter.

name: Ed Higdon
text: The place was fine but we had a set time frame in which to bowl. Not a big deal to get a couple games in before the time ran out, except for the fact that the lane quit working a number of times. Changing lanes didn't seem to matter for the people who started next to us because they moved from a lane that kept messing up to a lane that was messing up worse. That said, we decided to take our chances. Several times it took the staff as much as 10-12 minutes to get it working again because more than once I watched them hanging out chatting with other employees at the desk for more than 5 minutes after being told it had quit again. We didn't have any issues with the lanes at the other place in town so we went there a couple times more recently. It cost less with a groupon anyway I believe.

name: Selena Manning
text: The food was good! A little pricey for everything but we had fun! The bathrooms were clean and they had a lot to do beside bowl. Very nice facility!

name: Ethan Winters
text: Very fun and entertaining place. Music on projectors in back of bowling alleys is a plus. Lazertag course is top of the line and they even have tourneys! First time we went the lazer tag was unoperational but the manager gave us free passes to lazer tag and a gift card with 10 free credits to the arcade! The college student special for bowling was an extreme help considering me and my friends were on a budget. Extremely friendly staff and lots of cool stuff to do. Cheap prices make this a very enjoyable outing and i will definitely be visiting again. 100/10 would reccomend.

name: Matt Malecki
text: You get, what you expecting and more.

name: jess horton
text:
Pros: front desk staff was super nice, place was clean, and had well kept bathrooms. Lanes and decor were nice. Price was decent for three games and shoes about $15.

Cons: Waitress was a hot mess. Food was weird - got the garlic parmesan wings that tasted like they were buffalo wings fist then someone threw bit of extra seasoning on them. Also got the sample plate with no cheese bread. Took FORVEVE to get drinks.

name: Clegg V
text: This is where my family goes for good clean fun.

name: John Stanley
text: Awesome time and even better specials!!! A must go!

name: Denise Ruiz
text:
Overall was a good experience! They spaced you out in lanes which was nice til it was busy. We of course went with kids so it was a bit crazy. Ordered food and was quick as it could be as it was getting busy but with just the one waitress she was so overloaded with people she was slow the busier it got but she def did her best.
The bowling was fun. We didn't play arcade games that day but want to go back to play as they looked fun.

name: Baylee F
text: We went around 5 on Saturday. The employee working the front desk was very rude, didnt greet or speak to either my husband or I, only spoke to tell us to put our card in the chip reader. There were maybe only 7 other lanes in use at this point so they were NOT busy by any means. Went to order 2 drinks and an order of fries around 5:40 and the bar wasnt set up yet I guess? So we ended up waiting over 20 minutes for that order. The place is nice and clean but the staff SERIOUSLY needs to be talked to about customer service. We were completely ignored when we tried to check out as well until a girl walked by (despite there being people behind the desk ignoring us) and asked if we needed to be checked out. We wont be returning, definitely going to try out a different alley next time.

name: Jessica no mjk onee
text: Always have a great time . staff is extremely nice and helpful

name: Steve Burns
text: Great bowling alley.  Hosts the Pepsi Tournament annually and does a great job.   Large game area, and laser tag room.  Was given a tour of the facility by a friendly and knowledgeable associate. The only negative was extremely slow lane conditioning machines, but that only occurs before tournaments and leagues and does not affect open bowling.

name: Randall Colwell
text: First of all I haven't been here since it was Peach Bowl Lanes and boy was I in for a treat. This place looks and feels amazing. So to get to my experience we scheduled a King Pin Party Package here if you don't know what that is it's amazing what you get for you buck. We had an wonderful time bowling, great food and someone who actually knows how to make good mix drinks lol thanks bartenders. We want to get a BIG Shout Out to our lane server Michaela. She was on top of our party from start to finish never once did we have to search for her and very friendly A+++ service. Our second BIG Shout Out is to the Manager Lorenzo. We had a couple hiccups throughout the night nothing major but he was on top of it and made sure we had the best experience ever, we appreciate that man. Third an last shout out is to the man that set this all up for me over the phone Mr. John Cole. Without you and all your guidance and emails we would have never had this experience. Thanks again. If your looking for a good time and are over the age of 21 and wanna do a group event totally look into the King Pin Package here. I promise you that you won't regret the decision. Want to Thank the Bowlero of Columbus Ga for a great experience. Thank you all.

name: C Policastro
text:
Very large inside and can hold lots of people, great place for parties and hanging out. Bowling is a little expensive when there aren't any specials, at 2 games for $14 that's more than I'm used to spending. But the lanes and balls are in great shape and had no issues, except the lane we played in the 1 pin would fall down about 40% of the time after a reset, so our scores were a bit messed up.

The laser tag is a good size for maybe 5v5, any more and it's chaos unless you just want to sit still and not move around. The guns are clean and "cool" looking and are easy to use and you know when you aren't holding it right when it beeps so it won't shoot.

The bar area is decent size and staff was super friendly and quick service. There was only 1 dart in the board so we couldn't play darts.

I would visit again and bowl just when the games were cheaper.

text:
We had our 5 yr olds birthday party here and it was a complete success. The staff was on point and the manager made sure our guests had a wonderful time.
More than half our guests didn't show up and the manager adjusted the price down on the final bill. I was not expecting that and it made the whole experience even better.

text: Went here a neighbor's daughters Birthday party, there was NOT enough seats for all the adults to sit in. The establishment SMELT like old nasty carpet. The place definitely needs a good facelift.

name: Renee Adams
text: Great for kids parties... Nice Staff. Private room for cake and presents.

name: Ray
text:
My daughter went to a party here about a month ago and had a blast.

When it came time for her birthday party, she wanted to have here.

From someone who's attended a party as a guest and has hired pump it up, I can tell you the experience has been highly positive both times.

I love the way they take the kids around to to different rooms to keep them occupied. I also love the fact that the party guides bend over hand and foot to make sure you party is happy. They also minimize the work of the parent.

I basically brought in the party supplies and they took care of the rest.

Great attitude and a great experience; would definitely use again.

name: Danella Taylor
text: Kids had fun, but too young to understand the aftermath. After all monies was been taken, We heard the doors lock behind us. 2 minutes later,  police was touring the parking area, you could feel the "get off and out of the area quick". I feel this is NOT a place for our kids.  They will understand this as they grow older

name: Vanessa skripko
text: These pictures aren't all accurate. The party we attended had a slide only. After the kids get done jumping in the really hot room, you go to a slightly less hot cafeteria set up type area to celebrate. There are pictures that are adorable that were taken while the kids are playing. You don't get to keep them you just can view them for the short bit they are playing on the screen. My daughter and the birthday girl thought a better party would be held where there were more things than a slide. Surge and skyzone were both mentioned when the next has a party. I would say lessoned learned wish we knew just won't come back.

name: Lady Liam
text: A free day to let little kids run around for two hours? You bet! If you have a small child who likes to pretend your house in a jungle gym, this is the place to go. Two large rooms, plenty of space for everyone, and did I mention they have free days and stuff for birthdays?

name: Bradford Monk
text: Needs more parking. Staff nice but didn't seem very personable - young and inexperienced. Inflatables we're big and fun but seemed old and worn out. Almost no options for 2 year olds. Party rooms were a good size and clean. Bounce rooms smelled very sweaty.

name: Maureen Adams
text: Great prices to pay for the happiness PuMp It Up can give you and your kids. Low prices on their days of fun. You can make party reservations or just do daily visits the prices are low enough to maintain a fun day with an added bonus of having money left over to go out to eat.

name: Erica Dubose
text: We really enjoyed ourselves kids and Adults and the Staff is wonderful thank you so much.

name: Jessica ann
text: Our daughter had her 6th bday party here & it was a hit! Both friends and family bragged to me about how fun the party was, how organized it was, & how great the staff at pump it up took over and hosted the party.  The young staff at pump it up do an excellent job!! They did everything! Cut the cake, passed out pizza & drinks, played with the children, took pictures of the party, & even helped my daughter open her presents. The only thing I had to do was drive the car up & load them.  Amazing party experience & I’ve had parties for my kids at different surrounding locations & this was by far the best experience. The only downfall, it is a bit pricey, but the kids have a blast & in the end it was totally worth it to save a few months for this top notch experience. Thanks pump it up Trussville!

name: Olin Graham
text: I had a great time with my grandchildren, enjoyed Pump it up and will surely recommend it to all my friends. Though I'm still out of breath, I really enjoyed Pump it up.

name: Jennifer Faulkner Kerstiens
text: Getting a COVID-19 vaccine here was efficient and safe. Everything was done while I stayed inside my car. There was a station under a tent to be registered. Then I pulled forward into another tent where I was given my vaccine through my car window. Then I pulled forward into well- marked lanes to be monitored by nurses or practitioners for any sign of a reaction. Everyone I was there with had no problem at all. Thank you to all the amazing volunteers who helped make the process easy and comfortable. I was in and out in less than 30 minutes.
