name: Luan Brashaw
text:
My only experience at the Hoover Met is when I went to get a COVID-19 vaccination. This is what I will review..

UAB set up a vaccination site at the Hoover Met recently. It is an excellent choice of venue for giving drive-through vaccines. The large parking area is perfect for streaming through cars and lining up cars. It is off any major highway or heavily trafficked roadway. The UAB team have set up several pop-up pavilions wide enough to accommodate cars and UAB team members. The process is very simple and well-organized. I made my appointment through the UAB patient portal website. I noticed that the website made me a second appointment for my second vaccination 3 weeks after my first.  Very convenient. I arrived at my appointment time. There were people out directing traffic in the parking lot. At the first pavillion, a UAB team member gathered my name and appointment time, checked my ID, gave me a short form to fill-in and sign, then directed me to pull to the next pavilion, straight ahead. At the second pavilion, a UAB team member collected the form, gave the vaccination and immunization card and directed me to pull ahead to the waiting area. At the waiting area, a UAB team member greeted me, we conversed and they gave me instructions on how to alert them in case I had an adverse reaction to the shot. They made note of the time I received the vaccination and at what time the 15 minute wait period expired. During my wait, a UAB team member check on me verbally no less than 3x, other UAB team members would give me a nod or ask loudly to a group of cars how we were doing. The wait period flew by and I was on my way. From start to end the entire process took less than 45 minutes, probably around 30 minutes. I didn't time it. Overall, they were as well-organized as any Chick-fil-A drive-through and just as nice. Shout-out to the entire UAB team and any volunteers! Y'all Rocked It Out! Thank you for your hard work! Because y'all cared enough to be there, we are all one-step closer to normal.

name: Mark Criswell
text:
Beautiful complex of sports fields with adequate parking, good access and clean restrooms.

Big downsides, though:

1) Turf. Whoever thought that was a good idea for soccer never played soccer. Turf has higher injury profiles and retains heat. Air temp at player level above turf is about 5-6 degrees hotter than the nearby grass sidelines on a summer Alabama day!

2) Almost no cellular signal around the complex.  This is dangerous for kids playing outside, dealing with summer lightning storm delays. It is critical teams to be able to communicate among the players / coache / refs / parents. Unable to get updates on SincSports app and our team’s group texting app.

Can’t recommend this field for future tournaments for these reasons.

name: jeremy bailey
text:
Beware promoters and vendors. The management and staff running this building operate under strict rules and enforce them with an iron fist. No outside drinks will be allowed. If you bring your own water you will be told to take it outside and pour it out. So will all you vendors.  No outside food, all food must come from the cities concession stands. No snacks, breakfast bars etc... Or you will be asked to leave the building by the staff. No using the loading ramp to get in and out of the building. In fact the staff will park in front of it.  One vendor in a wheelchair was told that if they need to take food with their medicine every four hours it better be from the concession or they can "wheel themselves out to the parking lot to eat with their pills"
Summary: your vendors will complain to you and their peers. This type of behavior is not practiced in successfully run venues.

Your more than welcome to contact over Facebook since phone call is so hard. I even left messages on voicemail and talking with a person for my supervisor to call or someone. Twice she was there but an event was going to call after...NOPE. Guess events are more important. My power is off its cold. I was hired for security, between 30-40 hr. a week. 6 weeks 32 hours, manual labor.

Thanks

text: Mostly good experience.  Used the app to get on the wait list.  Said wait estimate was 10 minutes.  Closer to 25. So don't trust the online estimate.  Had a really nice server. name: shantrece d
text: The food was phenomenal. Hot fresh and seasoned just right. Huntsville Red Lobster is the poster child for restaurant perfection. The staff is warm neat and friendly, with fast service. The restaurant is also very clean and pleasant..I will definitely return to the city  just to eat here again.

resp.text: shantrece, we’re loving the 5 star review about our Huntsville team. We hope to see you soon for more of our classic seafood meals 🦞

name: Reverend Karen Fisher
text: Our server was Michael. He went out of his way to get us a dinner that wasn't even on the menu anymore. The food was cooked to perfection. The restaurant was clean as always. Partitions were secured between booths and staff wore masks. We had a wonderful time!

name: Michelle Stewart
text: My friend and I are lunch here. It was definitely fresh absolutely wonderful. Our waiter was amazing.  He made our dine in experience delightful.  Great food, atmosphere and terrific customer service.

name: Anthony Krones
text:
What can I say? Their food is great and the service was totally on point. Like, seriously, my drink was never empty.

As always, the cheddar biscuits were fabulous; hot and buttery.

The service was also extremely quick, even considering that we arrived 40 minutes before they closed. It was absolutely awesome.

name: Tilden Clark
text: The food is still very good after all these years.

name: Amber Brown
text: First time we ever went, and the service and food were fantastic! Initially, there was an hour to an hour and a half wait, which we understood being it is Mother’s Day, but they got us in within 30 minutes! Our waitress was Auburn, and she was incredibly sweet and helpful! My little sister loved her.. even went to hug her.

name: Ashleigh Mitchell
text: I can not even explain how good our food just was. I’m talking absolutely delicious. Every single thing was cooked perfectly and it all came out very quickly. We are regulars here but it seemed extra good today for some reason.

resp.text: Ashleigh, happy to hear you were well taken care of at our Huntsville Red Lobster Restaurant and we'll ensure this is passed along to our team! 😋  We hope to see you again soon for more of our classic seafood meals 🦞

name: Debbie D Walls
text: Great food and better service! The all you can eat shrimp fest is great on Mondays!

name: VW Insanity
text: It was mother's day food was good although my wife said the crab cakes were not as flavorful as she remembers. My fish and chips was wonderful and our server was on top of things. Being a Holliday and busy as mother's day can get over all was pleased 😀

resp.text: We’re glad you enjoyed every bite, VW! 🤤 😋 Thank you for visiting and giving our Huntsville Red Lobster restaurant, 5 stars. 🦞

name: East Nashville
text: Well to start, our server Arthur was fantastic! I never had to wait on a drink and he was polite and I could tell he knew what he was doing. He is the sole reason they even got 2 Stars. The food.....Oh the food. It was absolutely terrible. It was my wife's birthday and she really wanted to go here. It was my first time. I ordered some lobster tails she had the ultimate feast. When I got my food a $40 meal, my lobster was like a rubber band ball it was disgusting. I could barely rip it apart with my fingers. It could literally bounce. I had to cut it with a steak knife. I should have been fluffy, buttery and savory. I know it's not an ocean side restaurant but with a name like Red lobster I figured the lobster would be decent. I was so let down. Please make sure your cooks can at the most cook lobster. How is a place named Red Lobster serving such terribly cooked lobster. Your chef clearly doesn't belong at your store.  My in-laws ordered fish and chips. The fish had to have been dipped and breaded 15 times before it hit the fryer. When they finished they had almost an entire plate of batter that they picked and pealed off their fish. I was so embarrassed taking them here. My kids ordered the sirloin steak, they claimed to like it but they are kids, kids like anything. The steaks looked pretty beaten up and over cooked. Thank you Arthur for offering to replace the meal with a better cooked one,( "which I turned down" ) and thank you for being a fantastic server! I know that's a tough job. You were worth the $50 tip I left you. But Red Lobster I beg you to hire some efficient chefs and focus on training your cooks how to properly prepare lobster, steak and even a simple fish and chips. Find people who want to be there and who care weather their food is good. I'm not asking you to fire this person that cooked our food tonight but at the very least spend hours retraining them to cook your food the way it should be. I can't imagine how much money your company wastes throwing away food that was cooked terribly. I'm not sure I'll ever go to another Red lobster again which stinks because my wife raved about it, but it was just upsetting. I hope anyone who reads this doesn't have the same experience. I work too had for my $$$ to have someone not care how their food turns out. I don't blame red Lobster as I don't know their current situation but they have to know that their cook is not very good. Thank you for trying to make it right but first time is a charm. Thanks aka. EAST

resp.text: Our goal is to provide a 5-star seafood experience and we apologize for letting you down, East. If you’d like a follow up regarding your visit to our Huntsville Red Lobster restaurant, please send us a private message on Facebook. Please include the location you ordered from, details of your experience, and reference GM050421A. www.facebook.com/redlobster/ Thank you!

name: Joe Pierce
text: Great service, great atmosphere, great food! It's nice to be able to hear the person next to you for a change! :) Food was terrific and service was excellent. Highly recommend this Red Lobster to anyone craving seafood.

resp.text: Joe, glad you could stop in and that our Huntsville Red Lobster was worthy of your 5 star rating. Happy to hear you enjoy seafood as much as we do! 😍

name: Austin Bullard
text: To start, Service was decent. The food was another story. My lobster tail, which was about the size of a shrimp, was brought out brown. The Brussels sprouts smelled like a trash dump, and my steak was not good at all. This place has gone way downhill. Used to be decent but will not be returning.

resp.text: Austin - We appreciate the recommendation and we will forward your comments to our Huntsville Red Lobster team! If you’d like to have a member of our guest relations team follow up regarding your seafood dining experience please send us a private message on Facebook. Please include the location you ordered from, details of your experience, and reference GM052621A. www.facebook.com/redlobster/ Thank you!

name: Glenda Weaver
text: Our meal was delicious! The staff was very friendly and helpful. The restaurant was neat and clean. Will definitely be back.

resp.text: Glenda, we're glad to hear our Huntsville Red Lobster was worthy of your 5 star rating. Glad to hear you enjoyed seafood as much as we do! 😍

name: Google Mapper
text: What happened to that place? Red Lobster use to be a really nice place to eat. The steak and lobster meal was very disappointing. The small steak was overcooked and the dry lobster tail was smaller than a chicken finger! I was upset to discover that the service was much worse than the meal. My drink order was taken and I was provided bread. 20 minutes later, my drink arrives and I Insisted on placing my order. Dinner plate arrived 40 min afterward.  After eating my meal, I waited almost an hour before I could get someone to track down my server so I could pay and leave. If I had walked out without paying, it would have been hours before anyone noticed! NEVER AGAIN!! 👎

resp.text: We are sorry to hear the quality of food you received is not what you’d expect from our Red Lobster and we’d like to make your next visit a 5-star seafood experience. Please fill out our online form, along with the details of your visit, and reference GM042221A . ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm Thanks!

text:

I would complain about the wait time, but it was busy and you ARE given pretty heavy cheddar biscuits so it's no big deal.

I always recommend the Shrimp Alfredo, and you can't really go wrong with their drinks.

name: Stephen Judy
text: Went on a Saturday night just after the dinner rush. Friendly host seated us quickly.  Server was prompt and pleasant.  Ordered the spinach artichoke lobster dip and then placed our order. Appetizer showed up maybe 15 minutes later with our entrees about 30 seconds behind,  which is my biggest pet peeve.  Kitchen has no sense of timing a meal. The dip was great, meals were ok. Baked potatoes were undercooked.  My other side was left off and had to ask the server for it. All in all about what I expect from Red Lobster....good service, ok food, clueless kitchen.

name: Linder Metts
text:
May 27th - Our server was not wearing a mask. That order is still in effect until July 3rd. I was taken aback and perhaps this is on me for simply not getting up and walking out or bringing it up real time. This whole situation we all find ourselves in is awkward for all involved.  However, it is not on the customer's shoulders to enforce state rules. I just don't get it since it seemed most if not all of the other employees had appropriate facial covering.  Rationally I can tell myself that the exposure risk was probably low. On the other hand should I be having to go through that because a restaurant/employee couldn't be respectful of their customers?

Update 3 weeks later:  Although I never received anything other than a canned response on Yelp in spite of contacting them via their website, I made a visit last night in hopes of finding improvement and dinning. Well, incredulously, it was worse!  The State's mask orders are still in effect. Opening the door and entering this time even the host doesn't have a mask and the first server we see - no mask. We turned and walked out.  You have to ask yourself what kind of corporate/management approach so blatantly violates an obvious and easily implementable order. And if they have this disregard about the things you can see then what about those things you can't even during non-pandemic times.

This can be done correctly. I've witnessed it at many other both local and chain establishments. It boils down to commitment to customers or lack thereof.

resp.text: Hi, Linder Metts.  We’re so sorry to hear this and we hope you will give us another chance. Would you please fill out our online form and reference GM062320A in the comments section, so we can personally contact you and also know you first reached out to us here? My lobster bisque ( which I had to pay $3 extra) had NO lobster pieces.  Was totally liquid! I've had it before & it has always had a few little, tiny pieces of lobster in it.  So I was disappointed ☹️

name: Doug Johnson
text: Horrible service and horrible food. It all started when I asked for water, no lemon, and get brought back water with lemon. Not that big of a deal, it happens, simple mistake. I very foolishly paid for our food at the table tablet early as we were a bit short on time and wanted to leave as soon as we were done. Our food arrived and the steak was over done like shoe leather, the lobster tail was like eating a rubber band, and the side of fries was missing. The shrimp was at least alright. Our waitress was not seen again for 20+ minutes. She finally came back around, we mentioned some issues, and she vanished again. After several minutes, we caught some other waitress nearby and asked for a manager. After another 15+  minutes of no manager nor our waitress being seen, we left as we simply had no more time to waste dealing with this ordeal, we were already late at this point. We didn't get all the ordered food and half of what we did get wasn't even edible. It's bad when you leave Red Lobster and wish you would have stuck with Papa John's.

resp.text: Hi,Doug Johnson.  We're very troubled to hear this and we want to try and make this right. Would you please fill out our online form? When you submit your feedback, please  reference GM010320D in the comments section so that we know you first shared your experience here: ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm. Thank you!

text: This Red Lobster is just average because they are not consistent with their food portions and service. My point of view or opinions come from over 7 visits but take out only, can't tell you how the experience is if you choose to dine in. The fresh catch salmon portion is rather small for $19 plus tax. Summary; If you know of a better seafood restaurant then I would try them instead.

name: Scott Allman
text: Another packed Red Lobster. I just moved back into town from Memphis. The Red Lobster there literally has the same qualities, defects, pros and cons as the one here in Huntsville, AL. Both lack in cleanliness. At peak hours the bathrooms become disgusting. Which seems understandable based on the amount of human traffic one establishment can take, but at the end of the day cleanliness has to come first above all. The food tastes like it came off an assembly line. I have no idea how people who’ve had real seafood, down on the Gulf of Mexico, can stand to come home from vacation and eat this? There’s nothing fresh about it. I have nothing negative to say regarding the staff. They seem like they work extremely hard. Sometimes it seems like they’re just holding on. Much respect. Verdict? If you want real, fresh and delicious seafood...get in you car and head South till you hit sand.

resp.text: Hi,Scott Allman. We're troubled to hear this and we'd like to learn more. Would you please fill out our online form letting us know more and reference GM051619A in the comments sections? ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm. Thank you!

name: Jason Scrivner
text: Went on 5/22 and ordered curbside pickup. It took just shy of an hour, three phone calls that were each answered with indifference, and finally going inside to get our food. We were placated with a $10 gift certificate for the annoyance. I know we weren’t the only ones either as I saw a couple other cars waiting for just about as long as us only to end up having to go inside. What’s the point of advertising curbside service if you have no real intent of providing it? The whole point  was to avoid unnecessary contact, but we were essentially forced to go inside just to provoke any sort of response. This location has disappointed in the past, but never to the point of me feeling like posting a review; and like fools we keep coming back. This experience left us with a feeling that they just really don’t care, and that’s sad because we really like the product. That $10 gift card will probably end up in someone’s birthday card at some point because we’ll be hard pressed to go back any time soon.

resp.text: Hi, Jason.  We're very troubled to hear this and we want to try and make this right. Would you please fill out our online form? name: Pamela Hewlett
text: The linguini didn't have enough sauce real dry gave me double biscuits. They were dry. Seems they have some cooks that don't care

name: Kimberly Midkiff
text: The food was awful.  Food did not look photos Advertised. Calamari was so thick and too chewy.  Asparagus was not cooked.   Too hard too eat.  Service and waiter was amazing.  Pina colada s were the best thing about the meal.

resp.text: Hi Kimberly Midkiff, we’re sorry to learn about your disappointing experience at our Huntsville restaurant. We'd like to personally follow up with you to find out how we can improve. text: The service was pretty good. The main course was served before we had two bites in our salads. We requested to be served the salads first. The steak was unevenly cooked.

name: ANDREW PORTER
text: The manager is the kindest person I ever met in the restaurant industry she is truly a good person, hard to find these days!

resp.text: Happy to hear you enjoyed your experience with us, at our Huntsville Red Lobster!

name: James Truffa
text: Good place to eat

resp.text: You could've chosen any seafood restaurant and you chose us, James! 😍 Thanks for the 5 star rating and we're glad you enjoyed your experience. We can’t wait to see you soon for dinner or #RedLobsterToGo 🦞

name: Craig Whisenant
text: Our server, Veric, did a great job and was very kind.  He was the only thing positive about this visit and was very apologetic and embarrassed.  Cold food after waiting an hour and ten minutes for it to come out and we never heard from or saw a manager. I hope our Red Lobster isn't on its way out. 🙁

name: Battle Kitten
text: I Went in for lunch today at 1:00. I sat at the bar since I was alone and you usually get faster service at the bar. No one was there. No employees and only two ladies who were finished eating and sitting to talk. I waited two waiters bused tables around the bar. Finally a black guy came to the bar and answered his phone he talked and never acknowledged me. Employees milled around. A black girl came to chit chat with the hostess. Still no service. Black guy is still on the phone. Finally I left. Walking past the black girl and hostess no one said good bye thanks for coming. Not one person spoke to me.

resp.text: We're sorry you were unsatisfied with your experience, Battle Kitten. Would you please fill out our online form and reference GM110218C in the comments section along with your feedback? We would like a chance to make this right.  ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm

name: Milan Whit
text: Best seafood around!

text: Went there for New Year's, was the first time in 20 years.  It was pretty good.  Most of the seafood restaurants in Huntsville aren't very good.  The quantity was good.  The wait staff was good.  I had no complaints.

name: Dhruvil Patel
text: This is the worst place to eat at. Waiting time after ordering food was 45 minutes without anybody else being in the building. Waiter came out only once after taking order. When I ordered dessert they only came out with cake without ice cream and when I asked them where is my ice cream, they said that it’s after hours and they have already cleaned the stuff for it (scoop). They wanted to charge me for the whole dessert. When I asked for manager it took him about 15 minutes no exaggeration to come out. I will never eat at this place ever again. Also, it’s bad that when you enter the restaurant lobster’s in the tank greets you, but their is nobody at the front to greet you or anything. And the hostess asked us how long have we been waiting for.

resp.text: Hi Dhruvil Patel, we’re sorry to learn about your disappointing experience at our Huntsville restaurant and we’d like to know more. name: Duane Benson
text: We try to go when they offer the endless shrimp. Our server was less than solicitous, only brought drink refills one time and had to be reminded of the further order of shrimp (traditionally we have been offered numerous refills). The menu change no longer offers my favorite flounder, an entre I have eaten for more than 30 years. Little things add up: the check was brought to us just the receipt paper, was whisked away with our payment card, returned the same way, and finally collected from the table before we were able to get up and away (we did not linger lest one think the server was trying to get rid of us) Just disappointed with the overall experience.

resp.text: Hi Duane Benson, we’re sorry to learn about your disappointing experience at our Huntsville restaurant. We'd like to personally follow up with you to find out how we can improve. text: Had a great time I never have gone here beforehand a bit pricey but overall great service our waiter was awsome never short on drinks always asking if was ok and if we needed anything else the food was great I got crab legs and they were spot on next time I have some time and some $ I'm definitely coming back only thing I can say to make It better and a 5 stars is wash the outside of the potatoes a little better and add some sea salt because I enjoy eating the whole potato not just the inside other then that overall great and will come back

resp.text: Thank you for giving the Huntsville Red Lobster 4 stars, Wesley Mitchell, we look forward to giving you a 5 star experience next time.

text: Hadn't been here in awhile  (because I don't eat seafood), so I ordered the Maple-Glazed Chicken and my friend ordered the Coconut Shrimp. Both were excellent! And the cheddar biscuits,  as always, topped the meal off just right. The restaurant was clean, servers were nice. Not rushed and visited for awhile. A very pleasant evening!

name: Mark Toland
text: Went for shrimpfest and it was awesome. The wife had the Chicken Alfredo and she loved it. Got seated quickly on Sunday afternoon and our server Arthur was outstanding. We were never rushed and everything was just great. Going back as soon as next weekend. I would recommend just make reservations ahead online or be ok with waiting for  a few minutes which was worth it. Possibly the best experience I have ever had at Red Lobster. Enjoy!

resp.text: That sounds like the perfect evening at our Huntsville Red Lobster!

name: Eddie Grissett
text:
The cheese biscuits are very good. The Crab Alfredo is very good. It has way more flavor than the Shrimp Alfredo.
I don't think Walt's Favorite Shrimp would really be his favorite. The seemed like they had been battered and frozen in a factory. They were just average. Red Lobster's prices have gone way up, while the quality of the food is not that great.

text: The food was good, however, the waitress was very inattentive.  She took our salads and appetizers away while we were still eating them. text: Was greeted promptly at the door. Nice host. Was seated and greated immediately. Great server. She took care of us. Got drinks fast. And the food came out quicker than expected. And it was our date night haven't been on a date in 8 months. We'll  go back to Connors next time. Everything there is phenomenal.

text: Food was a 4 or above, service was slow and it wasn't crowded,  had to flag down the waiter for drink refills. Bread didn't arrive until the meal was being served and they were crispy. Overall it was a good expierence,  but could have been better.

name: Angela Harbin
text: Our order was wrong but we had a great waitress and she fixed everything.  The food was awesome. Been a few times and it just wasn't good. Definitely has gotten better. Cant wait to go back !

name: LT Luv
text: Food was not cooked well. Waited over 30min to speak with the manager, who never came but did refund the appetizer which was not the problem. Smh... will not be eating here again. The service has truly diminished over time.

text: Great food, great prices, service was great! A place to return to time and again!

resp.text: Glad to hear you enjoyed your experience at our Huntsville Red Lobster! See you soon.

name: David Jackson
text:
Tiffany was our waitress - she was outstanding. Kind, courteous, friendly, anticipated our needs and checked on us often.   She reminded me of when people cared about their customers and made them feel appreciated. She is a gem.
Food was very good and the birthday dish was very nicely decorated and presented.
Thanks for a great dinner.  See you again soon.

name: Frank P
text: My portion of Lobster Alfredo was very small, child size, and I ordered a full. The fish my husband ordered was bland and over cooked. The broccoli was mushy and the color of the tops was yellowish which meant old.

text: Superb service and food. I was also highly impressed with their functional allergy menu.

resp.text: Thank you for visiting our 1818 University Drive N.W. Red Lobster and for sharing your pleasant experience with us!

name: Alvie Rodgers
text: Excellent experience. I had Ultimate Feast. It was perfect. My wife had Walt's Shrimp and they were perfect. Seems you can always count on Red Lobster.

name: Phyllis Ledford
text:
We hadn't been there in at least a year. We finally went back 3 weeks ago and we had their Shrimp Scampi once again. We love their fried shrimp but we love Shrimp Scampi so much more. It is fixed in garlic butter. There isn't enough garlic butter for us. We had more added to it and we could tell there was garlic in the butter that time. That made it so much better...like it used to be. We like to put some of the sauce over our
vegetables, potatoes and even soak pieces of our bread in it. Sooooo good.

name: Patti Golden
text: Don't like their menu change

name: Oriana Brown
text: Had a reservation and still waited 30 minutes. While waiting we observed a low health department score that was just given days before. Mostly having food at the wrong temperature.  Server was nice and helpful but the food was just ok. The drinks were not good at all. It took awhile for the food to come out after ordering.  I would not return or recommend this place to anyone.

resp.text: Hi,Oriana Brown. We're troubled to hear this and we'd like to learn more. Would you please fill out our online form letting us know more and reference GM112618A in the comments sections? ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm. Thank you!

resp.text: That sounds like the perfect evening at our Huntsville Red Lobster!

name: Meagon Underwood
text: Service was undeserving of even one star. The server was very obviously annoyed that we were in her section. She walked up and introduced herself with an irritated vibe (she also added to her introduction that she was going to get us out of there fast due to the bad weather, which wasn't that bad) and asked for our drink orders then walked away without another word. Any time she came to the table she barely spoke beyond necessity, we would thank her for various things and she did not once acknowledge us. She brought half of my order out and I suppose my face expressed a question and she stared at me... the appropriate thing to say is, " Can I get you anything else?" I finally said, "Is the soup coming out now or later?" Her reply? "No, it's coming out now..." and a brisk walk away. To make dinner less enjoyable the staff were definitely not using professional language when they were in the kitchen (my table was next to the kitchen).The food was decent (hardly agree with the price verses value) but the service made the whole experience... I walked out remembering why we hardly visit that place.

resp.text: Hi Meagon Wood, we’re sorry to learn about your disappointing experience at our Huntsville restaurant and we’d like to know more. Please fill out our online form letting us know more about your experience and reference GM022619A in the comments section. text: it's good but when they're busy you can see a decline in the service promptness but positive attitudes all around. Food is better than it used to be. I used to have to go Decatur for good Red Lobster, not anymore.

resp.text: We’re America’s #1 Seafood Restaurant because of YOU, The! 😋 Thanks for being a lobSTAR 🦞 🤩 and we hope to see you back soon!

name: James
text:
Service:
Whether being helped at the bar or at a table I have no complaints. Waiters are prompt and very helpful.

Food:
I usually get the Salmon New Orleans and never had a problem. Sauce is extremely well made and salmon is great. Also good to note that I have never had a fish bone in my food... Thus far.

Another good recommendation is getting the 4 course meal as it's a great value and good to share.

Overall:
Never had an issue with this restraunt and hope that continues. I would highly recommend this location!

name: Kitsune of Inari
text: The place is usually packed but has a nice calm atmosphere. Servers are quick to take orders and bring drinks and are very nice. Food is always great at Red Lobster, however expensive. If your looking for a spicy dish here, order the Dragon Shrimp, really spicy and really good. Get a yuengling to go with it.

name: Jimmy Nance
text: The service was good waiting was fair

resp.text: Hi, Jimmy Nance. Thank you for visiting and giving our Huntsville Red Lobster, 5 stars! We look forward to serving you again soon.

name: Lianne Litzenberger
text: The food and the waitress were good, however there was a waiter  there who came across as very creepy when he walked passed our table, then stopped and yanked my 9 year old daughter's menu from her.  He apparently did it as a joke. Well it scared and upset her. He then kept talking and making it worse by saying things like "oh she's mad" etc.. He said sorry and then said he was going to get her and our son a toy. He came back with a broken airplane that wouldn't stop beeping and two stuffed animals. It was just a weird experience and my daughter didn't want anything from him. But why would an old man be joking like that with a child and then making it worse by continuing being in our upset daughter's presence and giving her toys that we don't know where they've been?  Are these toys from Red Lobster or did he bring them in himself? He was just a creepy guy who seemed like he had the maturity level of a 12 year old.  Why would you "joke with a child you don't even know and yank her menu off the table? Just leave us alone. he wasn't even our server to begin with.

name: donna thrower
text: Waited for over 2 hours with no chance of being seated in sight. Some of the people that were at their tables had been waiting for an hour to get refills. No wonder everyone was waiting most of the employees was having a good time out back smoking and chilling. They could have at least asked us to join their back porch party since they had no intention on feeding us.

name: Lisa Altheide
text:
Service was extremely slow...it took almost 40 minutes to get our food once we ordered ..There were 4 of us(3 adults, 1 children)...

As we were ordering, we found out they were out of a lot of items...For the prices we paid for our meals we expected to get what we wanted.. Some of the things we were told they were out of, bacon, cheese(we could not get loaded baked potatoes)...Couldn't order the  Berry mango drink they were out of the ingredients..couldn't order a daiquiri they were out of ingredients for it as well, they were out of onions

We ordered the 4 course meal for $15.99 and that came with brownie a La mode however can u guess it, they were out of that as well. We got the cake and ice cream instead and guess what they charged us and up charge for   getting the cake and ice cream even though the didn't have the brownie a La mo and our meal came with it... 😢

After we finally ordered, the kids meal came out first and it was suppose to be macaroni but it was a bowl of grease... We didn't even know grease was used to make macaroni.. The manager did come over to apologize but my nephew had to watch us eat because he is a picky eater and the only thing he will eat at Red Lobster is the macaroni.. When the manager came over she explained they usually use Kraft macaroni and cheese for the kid's meal but...can u guess. .they ran out and they were substituting ...

The manager did not offer a satisfactory resolution..

The service was so slow.. We ended up missing some of our movie..we will not return...

name: Teresa Brownfield
text: I love seafood and in Alabama you can not go just anywhere to get it. I took a friend and he was just amazed at the store, yes it was his first time LoL. Made my trip even more special. Great staff that gave us time to look over the menu so he could pick a great meal. And no one likes to be rushed on their first visit so all in all we had a wonderful dinner.

name: Chad Holland
text: Service has never been good, I ordered a Maker's Mark Manhattan. They brought me a double shot of Maker's Mark in a highball... When I asked the server she said oh they didn't have sweet vermouth... To which I asked if they were out or just didn't carry it, so I wouldn't order it again if they didn't carry it. Her answer.... " I ain't the bar tender I don't know..." Wow! I almost got up a left at that moment. Things were mediocre from that point forward as they were out of the first 3 dishes I ordered.... We never got the biscuits because "the kitchen done burnt 2 batches, I'll keep my eyes out" I tried to speak to the manager at the conclusion of our meal but to no suprise I couldn't find one... I walked around the dining room twice. We won't be going back!

text: I went during lunch and sat at the bar. The bartender was awesome!! She made sure our glasses were full, and she checked on us to make sure that things were still going well. Overall I had a really good visit.

text: My wife calls this her favorite place to eat. We have had mixed reviews the last few visits but yesterday's meal was one of the best we have ever had. We kept talking about it all evening.

name: norm ginty
text:
Clean and comfortable
Prompt and friendly service.

I Hart the lobster Math Mac and cheese
Very good but could have had a little more lobster.
I also had the hot lobster roll well worth the price.  I am from New England so am a little spoiled but good deal for the price
The clam chowder was really good and again in groom New England so...
With a beer total came to line $32.

When my mother came to visit thus is one of the places we would go.
Yesterday would have been her 93d birthday so I celebrated in remembrance.

I would come back

name: Neil Young
text: My wife and I had a craving for some red lobster so we stopped in . We were seated very quickly and our waitress arrived and took our orders for drinks quickly.  It took a little bit but our waitress made her way back around and got our orders. Our food came out hot and fresh. My appetizer never did make it out so I asked to have it removed from my ticket which our waitress took care of. It seemed as the restaurant filled up with the Sunday crowd our waitress became more attentive which was good. The overall experience was ok, things have changed I guess with red lobster and just kinda went somewhat flat. The restroom was clean but had hand towels all over the floor and was in a slight disarray.

name: Caitlyn Hoppe
text: Customer service way off. We ate here because we got a giftcard for Christmas and it turned out to be a big mistake. We ordered an appetizer, soup, salad, and dinner entree. Our appetizer came out and the waiter set it down on the table and quickly walked away as I was trying to tell him he didn't give us any plates or forks. So from the get go I was irritated. We tried to flag several people down and were ignored each time. So after getting no help we started eating our shrimp appetizer with our hands. Finally a different server helped us and got us some forks. But still no plates. Our appetizer was gone by the time our original waiter finally came back to the table and mumbled "I shoulda been brought these out to ya" at me and finally got us plates and biscuits. Then our dinner entrees were brought out by yet another different server. We tried to ask for our soup and salad but she turned and walked away so quickly I don't think she heard me. We had nearly finished our dinner entrees by the time our original server came to check on us, and instead of apologizing for the mistake just said "yeah I know" when I said we had ordered a soup and salad. If you know, then where is my food? We both finished our dinner entrees before he brought our soup and salad out and by that point we were already full. I paid $8 for a bowl of soup I didn't even eat. The manager comped one of our meals but I will never go back there after that experience.

resp.text: Hi,Caitlyn Hoppe. We're troubled to hear this and we'd like to learn more. Would you please fill out our online form letting us know more and reference GM022019E in the comments sections? ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm. Thank you!

text: This visit was for our 10th anniversary and it was a vast improvement over last year. Our meals were just as we ordered and the price was a little more than last year but it was still a good value. The lobster my wife ordered was cooked to perfection and probably weighed more than what we ordered  (we were charged for the smaller one). The service was excellent. There was one patron that was very loud initially but he soon left and that helped restore the atmosphere one would expect from a nice establishment. Overall a satisfying experience. We will be visiting again for her birthday in May.

text:
It was Saturday night and the crowd was in. We had the choice of waiting 30 min, or we could eat at the bar.
We sit down and can immediately see the two ladies working are swamped with work. We waited patiently and our bartender got to us. She got our drinks pretty quick(Bahama Mama for my wife which she loved and in sweet tea for me which was good tea) and got us ordered.

We again patiently wait(more so than people who sat near us who just sat for a little bit and then left) and our food comes out. It was fantastic and now I have some great leftovers to enjoy. Our bartender was gracious for our patience as we were to her helping us.

name: Lynda Smith
text: Back in the good days red lobster was awesome. However, the last few years I really don't know what the hell has happened. The crab legs are smaller than a pencil, the lobster is approximately 2-3 ounces...we actually had to ask for our silverware and napkin's, obviously when you're having to crack open your food your ganna need even more napkins. What you see in TV is NOT what you get. The following week we went to out back, what a difference, I actually got the proper size lobster, with a steak! Hmm!! Lesson learned.

name: Eric B (GodSponge)
text: Food is always great here. We used to have issues with our waiters, but lately we've had incredibly good service.

name: Bee J
text: Terrible!! Not only is this restaurant dated, the food has become increasingly poor. I've gone to Red Lobster numerous times, too many too count. I have had many instances of unsatisfactory service (the latest being 5 minutes ago) but I give them chances because they are one of a few seafood restaurants in this area. And I love my snow crab. I Ordered food online was late to make sure the food would be ready (9:52) the food wasnt brought out until after 10:15. No problem.... Things Happen...but then the biscuits were burned (paid for these extra biscuits, I wish I could attach pics) asked for new biscuits and decided to order a chilled shot of patron. The bartender PUTS ICE WATER IN GLASS (in a poor attempt to chill the glass) and pours the warm shot in the glass. This is not chilled, strike 2. Asked for a lime after we had to wait to get her to turn and we were the only 2 people at the bar besides the bartender. The bartender LITERALLY brought a lime with her BARE HANDS and said here you go. No napkin, no tooth pick, straight hand to hand contact. Clearly she should have not been working the bar. Didn't even want the drink just wanted to kill time until the food came back that they screwed up. Paid for the drink and she says have a good one. WHERE ARE MY BISCUITS???? she NEVER brought them back out. I said forget it and left with the burned biscuits which are inedible. This is the LAST time I will visit this red lobster. Until they revamp and retrain their staff... They have lost 2 customers. I mean the carpet even stinks here, you can smell it reeking and there is so much dust your allergies with not like you. It's a shame you spend all this money for subpar quality. Shame on you Red Lobster!!!

name: Star Set
text:
I went here last night to celebrate our anniversary..but the service was booo!

The waitress had a nice demeanor, great attitude..exclusively toward my boyfriend...I have no idea what I did to tick her off in the time it took to greet and seat us but she made sure to let my glass stay empty until my boyfriend could not tolerate her blatant disregard for me.

Having made sure his coke was topped off throughout dinner, she came to the table yet again to ask him if HE wanted a refill When it was MY glass that was empty at the end of the table. He then told her to fill mine and she says, "oh. okay." in a questionable tone.

She also made sure to extend the "couple more minutes" we needed to look over the menu, to about 15-20 minutes..she was a ghost half the night then had the nerve to ask about dessert. I was turned so far off of asking her for anything more than the check and even getting that was complicated..

All told she served the family behind us very well so something was fishy.. The crab okay but sadly we will not be returning.

name: Kelli Black
text: We took my father to lunch yesterday to the Huntsville Red Lobster. He is 85 and a veteran from World War II, Vietnam, and Korea. He retired to   Huntsville almost 30 years ago. He has been going to the Red Lobster there for 30 years.  We had our meal and he insisted on paying the bill. He handed me his wallet which had 3 crisp 50 dollars bills inside. He asked to take two and put them in with the bill.... he wanted to pay the 47 dollar bill and get change to tip the waiter.  I removed the two bills and he ask that i lay them side by side in the envelope so that they did not get stuck together and so the waiter could see there were two and not just one. The lunch was slow taking almost two hours to complete so he finally asked if we could make our way to the car while my wife stayed and waited for the change.  i brought him to the car and we waited for another 20 minutes but my wife did not come.  Finally she did come out and was blown away.  The waiter came back by the table and through the plastic bill holder on the table and said there was no bill or money inside and that he was reprinting the bill for my wife to pay again. I went back into the restaurant to talk to the waiter, but he wouldn't even talk he left for a bit and the manager came out to talk to me. He said that i must have dropped the money and the bill and asked if it was in my pockets. I explained that I knew for sure the money was there because my dad had asked be to take the money from his wallet and to lay the bills next to each other so not to have a mis understanding and that i had closed the plastic envelope before is left and my wife had not even touched it.. only the waiter had touched it.  The manager did not seem to know what to do, but said if i left my number he would call if it turned up. It was a bad situation for everyone. The lady;s sitting across from us leaned over to my wife and said ' we saw you pay the bill"...  I finally decided that having my dad at the restaurant for 2 and a half hours was too long for him to be up so I just told them to keep our money and i left. name: Lakeysha B
text:
It's still a nice restaurant chain. Unfortunately this time we had a large party and the wait was 1 hour which actually turned into an 1hour and 40 minutes. The manager appologized for the wait around the 1 hour mark.

Finally seated and starving and irritated. It would have been nice to have a complimentary appetizer or two brought to the table by the manager to appologize for the excessive wait time. Nope. So we resorted to asking the waitress for bread which they despise because they are not supposed to bring them out till after you order. Oh well.
Other than that the menu has a good variety and the prices are decent.

name: Zachary White
text:
Can’t say I’d recommend this location, at least not based on this particular experience. The service was very poor (despite not being particularly busy, in the ~2 hours of our being there, the server only voluntarily visited our table 3-4 times).

As for the meal itself, the iced tea I was served tasted funny. The dish I ordered had a choice of New York Strip or Filet Mignon and, despite not indicating a preference, the server never asked me which I’d like. The Caesar salad had maybe 3-5 shavings of parmesan on it and the lettuce was rather limp and not crisp. The shrimp scampi was fine; it tasted of garlic and not much else. The wood-grilled shrimp was meh; it was lackluster in terms of flavor, due in part to its complete lack of seasoning. In general everything was pretty bland.The “steamed” broccoli was instead maybe half-steamed, i.e. it was half-raw, therefore rather crunchy. And even the ~$11 Lobster Tail was over-cooked, dry, and bland (also it wasn’t served with butter).

Based on this experience, I would recommend going to a different location or, if you find that the quality does not improve elsewhere, pick a different restaurant altogether. 3/10.

I went here last night to celebrate our anniversary..but the service was booo!

The waitress had a nice demeanor, great attitude..exclusively toward my boyfriend...I have no idea what I did to tick her off in the time it took to greet and seat us but she made sure to let my glass stay empty until my boyfriend could not tolerate her blatant disregard for me.

Having made sure his coke was topped off throughout dinner, she came to the table yet again to ask him if HE wanted a refill When it was MY glass that was empty at the end of the table. He then told her to fill mine and she says, "oh. okay." in a questionable tone.

She also made sure to extend the "couple more minutes" we needed to look over the menu, to about 15-20 minutes..she was a ghost half the night then had the nerve to ask about dessert. I was turned so far off of asking her for anything more than the check and even getting that was complicated..

All told she served the family behind us very well so something was fishy.. The crab okay but sadly we will not be returning.

name: Joanne Reynolds
text: Went there yesterday for a late lunch around two with my husband. There weren't that many people there. Stopped at the hostess stand and she was on the phone talking to someone about a lost article. No big deal so we waited several minutes while she finished her phone conversation. There was also a male employee who was stacking menus who just ignored us. The female hostess gets off the phone and seats us. We look through the menu and make our selections. I realized that we still had not even been greeted even though 3 other tables had been seated after us and were approached by their waiters and were given drinks and biscuits. Still no waiter even though there were two waiters standing by our booth right behind my husband. Our booth was at the end so they were just a couple of feet from us and I am sure that they could hear our conversation wondering why we didn't have a waiter. At that point I pulled out my cellphone to keep track of the time. We had been sitting there for almost fifteen minutes when a female waiter passed us and said our waiter would be there in just a minute. A few minutes more went by before a female waiter who had an order of food to deliver paused at our table and asked if we knew what we wanted to drink. I told her that we had been sitting there for quite some time and already knew what we wanted to order to eat. She said okay that she would be right back and would take good care of us. I saw her deliver the food and then go to another table to take their order. My husband and I just looked at each other and got up and left. I can't believe that there were waiters standing around and nobody had waited on us in all that time. It was inexcusable and I will be sure to let everyone we know what poor service we were given. I could understand if it was busy, but there weren't many tables occupied.

name: Justice Writer
text: Every time we visit a Red Lobster and especially the one in the Huntsville, Alabama on University, we say, never again.  This time, Niadja, our waitress was caring; but she gave us dinner pricing when our visit was at lunchtime. Is it legal to charge dinner prices at lunch claiming that the sizes are larger without notice or consent from the customer? We never got the towelettes we requested until the end, either.  In Japan, for instance, a nice hot cloth towel is afforded to the patrons prior to eating. On the same note, Japanese peeps don’t wear shoes indoors either so why would we expect for an American restaurant to provide us hand wipes prior to eating? Our seats were too close together, so we moved. But, the table we moved to wobbled and caused damages to us as well as to our belongings. Thomas, the manager was rude and indifferent. Niadja was to apply a $4.00 coupon which led to our finding out about the pricing deceit. Our hot-spot was being used; but Thomas wouldn't let us use their DSL to get the $4.00 coupon from our Trash. Thank GOD $4.00 won't break us since GOD has given us so much. It's the principal of the matter, though. On our visit previously, a man came in seeking stuff and it was not until he started to bother other guests did management ask him to leave. Plus $1000 was stolen from an acquaintance of ours from her purse while she and her friends were eating there a while ago. On second thought, the people there are very unhappy, the waitresses never smile and purposely catch your eye only to give you a mean look. What a shame.

text: Me and my husband went Sunday for our first date night in months. Our server was Missy! She was really sweet she moved us to a tv where my hubby could watch tv. Once moved we were seated in a booth in the bar area where we were intruded by a giant waterbug. My hubby knocked it down and a server not ours came and ran it from under our table where as i stepped on it. The manager came out and said i heard you all had a friend. We received our ultimate feast and asked for togo boxes and our check. The manager didn't take anything off evrn though it was a terrible exoerience that caused a loss of appetite for us both. I mean who wants to eat and see big roaches. We paid our whole bill tipped our waitress and left. We will not be going back!!!!

name: Arreis “NaturalDiva” Black
text: I sat at the bar. After sitting there for a few minutes they finally figured out who would come take my order. I could tell the waiters were a bit inexperienced. The beef tips rice and gravy was good, not overly salty and the meat was thoroughly cooked. The decor looked good, different from a lot of other similar spots in ttown. Although I wasn’t too satisfied with the service, i will eventually visit again just to give another item on the menu a try.

name: Carrie Reed
text: Ohhhh my goodness! This was the BEST seafood i have eaten! Me and my daughter enjoyed it so much. It is clean with a great atmosphere! Our waitress was awesome, friendly and checked on us regularly. I was so impressed with Aces! I cannot wait to return for some more. We got the Royal Flush and it was absolutely amazing! We are still talking about how good the food was hours later! Visit them!!!

name: Glo Boy
text: Had a 30 min lunch. Got my food in 40 min. Then it didn't even taste good.

name: marvin hinton
text: I had a good meal. Took a few minutes but it was fresh. Nice fried Green Tomatoes, Fry's and some Parmesan Garlic Wings.  All was good. Friendly environment nice and Clean.

name: Cake n Craft
text: The food was pretty good. The service was fair, but the bathroom was the overall downfall. There was used napkins/tissue all over the bathroom, and alongside the wall where the trashcan was. There was at least one beer bottle with a put out cigarette butt in it. AND to top it all off, there was no tissue nor paper towels to use in the restroom. Completely unsanitary! I wish I had known this before sitting, and paying for my meal!

name: Cherelle Young
text: I ordered the Royal Seafood platter. It was delicious. The customer service was exceptional! This was my first visit but will not be the last.

name: Jackie Jackson
text: I sat at the bar and the waitress looked like a deer in headlights when I asked for a drink. She told me that she didn’t know if there was anyone there who could make a drink. After asking around, she came back and told me “yes, she can fix it” and pointed towards a young lady sitting in a nearby booth. After waiting another 10 minutes, I turned to see that the impromptu bartender was in a deep conversation on the phone and did not look to be in a hurry to service me. I ended up leaving and going somewhere else. I have never heard anyone speak highly of this place and now I know why.

name: Charles Hall
text: Food the food tasted great just a service need a lot of improvement because they leave you hanging.  we ordered some green fried tomatoes which was really tasted great, but three people eating out of a basket wasn't cool, sooo we asked for sauces , which never got them. (Manager)not prompt food, but it tasted good once you got it ,the place smoke and you know this was the cooking

name: Vanessa Williams
text: There for s Birthday party. Late. But the waitress noticed new faces and immediately came over.Assissited us with our order and was back with them fast.Nice comfortable atmosphere.Security was on point.Ordered Philly cheese steak to bring home and i opened it to check it out,it look so good made me want to eat it but i don't eat cheese but the green Tomatoes ( shook cheese off)broke a pc.delicious.1st time there and it was nice.

name: Samantha Williams
text: I ate here with a large party on a Friday night. Server was nice however you could tell she was overwhelmed and the cook staff was as well. They ran out of their seafood special and didn't inform our party until an hour after we placed our orders. Some people in our party did not receive their food after almost 2 hours, but the owner was gracious enough to provide a different meal at no charge. The food was mediocre, nothing to write home about. This restaurant has the potential to be great, the staff just needs to work out some of the kinks.

name: Fran Duncan
text: Really enjoyed the visit. The food was very good. Being a new restaurant the service was a little slow. Music was a little loud.

name: Jordan Gardner
text:
I try and support black owned businesses but Aces ain’t help the cause. Today was third time giving them a try and they let me down again. They are always out of something and never can complete a whole meal. Good luck to those who try them
Out in the future. I pray they get they shht together.

name: Lolita Turner
text: Customer service sucks! My friend & I waited a long time to get our drinks then had to wait a very long time to get our food. They had tons of workers but everybody was standing around talking. After I got my bill, I put no tip & the waitress took it upon herself to take her own tip. I didn’t notice til I check my account. I wouldn’t recommend anybody to go here until there’s more training!!

name: Cenchrea Dykes
text: I enjoyed the food as well as the prices here. My husband and I dined for less than $25! Waitresses were very attentive and polite. They do not have the alcoholic drinks or hookas available as of yet, but once its all up and running I do believe this will be a nice place to eat out!

name: LaSonya Eatmon
text: My three of a kind platter was delicious and very well seasoned. Will be going back to Seafood Fridays!

name: Shon Mobley
text: Great Atmosphere.. Fast Fun and Friendly Service.. Great great Food!

name: Felicia Byrd
text: I can't really comment on the food. I call for 30 minutes couldn't get ithem to pick up the phone to place a to go order. I guess is  Bob's victory grille to night.

name: dustin dailey
text: I don’t see this place staying in business very long.   First thing I noticed was the smell, it didn’t smell like food being cooked.  It had a mildewed bathroom smell throughout.   We were seated at a dirty table. I attempted to wipe it with napkins. the hostess noticed and took the dirty napkins I used and seen the table was still nasty but did nothing but attempted to hide some of the crumbs still on the table.      I had chicken wings thinking it would be a safe bet.  But they was very small and disappointing, no meat, they was soggy not crispy.  Fries was soggy also, no crisp.        My friend had the seafood boil thing with shrimp, sausage, one crab cluster, corn and potatoes. It came with a small cluster, 2 slices of sausage the size of quarters.  5 small shrimp smaller than a quarter 2 pieces of corn and a half potato. . Way over priced for what you get.    Service was Terrible, it took forever to get our drinks. And I ended up getting my own refil after being ignored. Definitely felt like we was being avoided the whole time there.  And to top it off... After eating we seen a mouse run from the booth we was setting, into the ladies bathroom.  We were grossed out and left hungry.      Needless to say we will not be back.  If I could put zero stars I would.

name: Louise Lewis
text: First visit.   The chicken wings were really delicious.  The food was freshly prepared and served hot.

text: Great customer service and great food!

text: Worst experience ever. Wings were soggy and I asked for crispy took 45 minutes!!!!

text: I was very disappointed with my entire dining  experience. I will not recommend this place to anyone. I gave it one star because that's the ONLY way I could post

name: Cherri Collins-Wiley
text: The Seafood and Loaded Fries get 5 stars!!! #excellent

name: Latrika Woods
text: God knows I wanted so badly to support this restaurant. However, the service is awful. We sat waiting for a waiter for a while after being seated. Three different waiters passed our table before Rakira (the only one who has excellent service and professionalism) finally stopped to ask if someone had taken our drink order. The place was not busy because we went around 12:30pm after getting out of church. My husband and I were given menus that were different. Most of the items on my menu were no longer being served. The restaurant needs some serious training on service and professionalism. The waitress brought our drinks over while talking on the phone. I don't think I will be coming back here anytime soon. Everything I wanted they were out, down to the watermelon tea and simple ranch to go with your wings. As we were leaving one of the waiters told a family it would be a 10-20min wait because there was on three servers. The food was great, but it is hard to enjoy the food when the service is so awful. Others members from our church who had gotten there earlier had the same sentiment. One of the young ladies yelled across the restaurant (seriously??!!). I love to support my black-owned businesses, but this place needs a whole new staff (except for Rakira). I pray they get it together or they will not be in business for long.

text:
So I'm on a diet, BUT, I kept hearing about this place from my folks out this way, so the last time I was in the area and I stopped on by. Initially, I was thinking that I'll still be on my strict diet, but after realizing the only thing suiting for me would be water and air, I had to restart my membership to the  (stretch mark crew what-it-do) and ordered mac, greens and wings..

OMGG y'all soooo worth the pounds I gained!! I wanted to literally kidnap the cook yo! Dear Lort, please let them cater and ship to the east coast??? Hopefully, that is coming before family cookout seasons arrive.

I'll definitely visit when I'm back in town for the food+vibes+dranks.

I'll try them on Soul Food Sunday. I'd like to post a pic of my nicely plated food.

text: I am here for a wedding reception, just beautiful

name: Ron Harris
text: Great place to host a wedding and reception.

resp.text: Thank you!  We only want the best experience for our guests!  It means the world to us that you had a wonderful time while you were with us.

name: Taylor Ormon
text: The Southerly was the absolute perfect venue for our wedding this past March! They could not have been more accommodating to our needs and wants during the entire planning process. I planned my wedding from afar and each time I came into town and needed to meet with one of the wedding coordinators they made time in their busy schedule to make sure they could meet with me. The customer service is absolutely outstanding, the day of the event we did not have to worry about one thing. During the reception they made sure that we were taken care of and that everything ran smoothly. My vendors could not have been more complimentary of the constant communication that The Southerly had with each of them giving them all the details they needed. I would recommend this venue to all! I had the best experience and would not change a thing. Thank you for making it a night that we will cherish forever!!

resp.text: We are so glad to hear this! The Southerly strives to make sure each bride feels taken care of throughout their planning experience. Thank you so much for your feedback, Taylor!

name: Leigh Richards
text: What an incredible venue. Julia was amazing .Every detail was perfect. What a spectacular experience for my daughter's wedding

resp.text: We are thrilled to hear such good things! Thank you so much for your feedback, Leigh.

name: Shannon Doyle
text: The most amazing staff and facility . I had this wonderful women, who is so sweet , caring , and catered to my every need .Most importantly sometimes my 5pm last minute phone calls when she should be getting off work she stayed on the phone with me after hours. I would definitely recommend !!

name: victoria Mechete
text: Great eclectic space for small events and pop ups

resp.text: Thank you for your review!

name: Kevin Gardner
text: Great facility for a wedding. Gorgeous decor. Great location.

name: Janet Johnson
text:
Pros:  Beautiful wedding venue
Cons:  $$$$$; inattentive staff on day of wedding;  phone calls not returned; facilities, including main entrance doors, under renovation.

resp.text: Janet, thank you for the feedback! We apologize for your experience not meeting every expectation you had. We strive to make sure our guests are well taken care of throughout their unique event planning journey with us. Exceeding our guest expectations through planning and southern hospitality is our primary goal. With that said, we apologize that you felt otherwise. We'd love to have a conversation with you personally about how we can improve; please give us a call at your convenience. Your perspective is highly valued. Thank you again for your feedback.

name: Kelli Daniel Taylor
text: The historic Avon Theater is experiencing a renaissance under top-notch new management. It has a cool downtown vibe, romantic details and incredible service. There's a reason Avon is a favorite among wedding couples and clients looking for a unique event space. Out of town guests will appreciate the central location and after-event options for nightlife and restaurants. A great choice for memorable occasions! As a professional photography service, Kelli & Daniel Taylor Photography, we love shooting there.

name: Lauren Roth
text:
Alabama brides: the Avon Theater is a sometimes overlooked but spectacular gem of a venue that really should be at the top of your list if you're looking for a unique space to get married! It has such beautiful exposed brick, original details like plaster murals, and a historic charm to it. It's also right in the center of Birmingham, so everyone you're inviting to your big day will be close by, or if they're traveling from out of town, it's close to a lot of really great places to stay and eat in town! (Babalu, anyone?)
As a wedding vendor myself, I can say that the venue offers a great value for the space, and it's the perfect place to flip from ceremony to reception or even segment off into 2 areas with the built-in stage for the reception space.
Plus, the ladies who manage the venue, Courtney and Julie and their team, are wonderful people who really are a joy to work with. They're knowledgable and experienced in the wedding field, they make events seamless, and as I've worked with them before, I've watched them take care of and serve their clients so well. If you're getting married in Alabama anytime soon, you should most definitely go visit Avon Theater for the perfect B'ham wedding spot!

name: Caitlin Sloane
text: This gorgeous venue in the heart of Birmingham is truly a diamond in the rough. The historic theater has truly amazing planners, as well as breathtaking exposed brick and lovely high ceilings. If you are looking for a venue that will blow you away with its rustic charms, look no further than Avon Theater!

name: Robbie Dyson
text: As a catering company in the Birmingham area for over 27 years, we have had the pleasure to work in  many venues.  Avon Theatre has been one of our favorites for a long time and still does not disappoint. It's location is so central to all of the fun things Birmingham has to offer.  The main room has such great open ceilings and makes the perfect back drop for any occaision.  They offer great rental rates as well to help your budget go farther when planning an event.  Be part of Birminghan history and book your event at The Avon Theatre.

name: Chirleen Evans
text: A beautiful area, the trees are gorgeous! The young man who is currently serving as camp host was very pleasant and accommodating. However, upon our arrival, it wasn't very clear how to actually check-in. It was mid-afternoon on a Friday and the onsite General Store was closed. There was a sign on the door with a phone number so I called that and we were told to find a site and the camp host would arrive shortly. We stayed in the tent camping section for 3 nights, total cost was $66. Unfortunately the nearest outhouse was quite a walk from our site and we were only about halfway back into the camping area. I've been camping for 34 years and I don't think I have ever had to walk that far to use a bathroom. We had to drive to the bathhouse for showers because it's even farther than the outhouses and it's partway down a 25 mph road without sidewalks. While the bathhouse was pretty clean, the mini trash cans were not emptied the entire time we were there and with only one shower in each of the men/women's bathrooms, we often had to wait in lines with 2 or 3 people ahead of us. There's a great boat launch which was being utilized for a fishing tournament qualifying event the weekend we stayed so there was a ton of trucks/trailers coming and going and when we left in our car for a trip to town, we were blocked into the tent area by trucks lined up to pull their boats out of the water. There are signs posted not to block the road, and I realize how difficult it would be to enforce it, but I would recommend anyone planning to stay to check if similar events might be held and avoid the park at those times. Also, for some strange reason the tent area road was blocked off in several places by rope so we had to kind of forge our own way in some places which concerned me since I don't have a 4-wheel drive vehicle.  I think overall it's a really great campground, we felt isolated from other campers and our site was beautifully situated in the shade on a bluff above Tensaw River. The bugs were kind of bad but that was expected, we were prepared with bug spray. We also kept a smoky fire burning which helped.  I would love to see an outhouse placed in the middle of the tent area since the closest one was at the boat launch. I also recommend adding a map of the grounds to your website. We'd stay here again if there was an outhouse added to the tent area; otherwise, we probably won't come back which sucks because it's really beautiful. We really did enjoy ourselves, though.

resp.text: Thank you !
